ProSHADE  0.7.3 (JUL 2020)
Protein Shape Detection
Public Member Functions | Public Attributes | Protected Member Functions | List of all members
ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data Class Reference

This class contains all inputed and derived data for a single structure. More...

#include <ProSHADE_data.hpp>

 How much the map was moved along the X-axis to achieve COM centering.

 The number of spheres with map projected onto them.

 The set of concentric spheres to which the intermal density map has been projected.
 
proshade_complex ** sphericalHarmonics
 A set of spherical harmonics values arrays for each sphere.
 
proshade_complex ** rotSphericalHarmonics
 A set of rotated spherical harmonics values arrays for each sphere, used only if map rotation is required.
 
proshade_unsign maxShellBand
 The maximum band for any shell of the object.
 
proshade_double *** rrpMatrices
 The energy levels descriptor shell correlation tables.
 
proshade_complex *** eMatrices
 The trace sigma and full rotation function c*conj(c) integral tables.
 
proshade_double integrationWeight
 The Pearson's c.c. type weighting for the integration.
 
proshade_complex * so3Coeffs
 The coefficients obtained by SO(3) Fourier Transform (SOFT), in this case derived from the E matrices.
 
proshade_complex * so3CoeffsInverse
 The inverse coefficients obtained by inverse SO(3) Fourier Transform (SOFT) - i.e. rotation function.
 
proshade_complex *** wignerMatrices
 These matrices are computed for a particular rotation to be done in spherical harmonics.
 
proshade_unsign maxCompBand
 The largest comparison band - this variable tells how large arrays will be allocated for the comparison.
 
proshade_complex * translationMap
 This is where the translation map will be held, if at all used.
 
bool isEmpty
 This variable stated whether the class contains any information.
 
proshade_unsign inputOrder
 This value is the input order - it is useful to know for writing out files, so that they would not overwrite the same name multiple times.

Detailed Description

This class contains all inputed and derived data for a single structure.

This class codes the object that contains all the information about the input data and the derived information as well. It does not, however, provide the computation code as that lives elsewhere, except for the forward declarations.

Definition at line 48 of file ProSHADE_data.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ ProSHADE_data() [1/2]

ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::ProSHADE_data ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

Constructor for getting empty ProSHADE_data class.

This constructor creates an empty data structure which can later be filled with data and used to process these data further.

Parameters
[in]settingsProSHADE_settings object specifying what should be done.
[out]XEmpty data object with deault values.

◆ ProSHADE_data() [2/2]

ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::ProSHADE_data ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::string  strName,
double *  mapVals,
int  len,
proshade_single  xDmSz,
proshade_single  yDmSz,
proshade_single  zDmSz,
proshade_unsign  xDmInd,
proshade_unsign  yDmInd,
proshade_unsign  zDmInd,
proshade_signed  xFr,
proshade_signed  yFr,
proshade_signed  zFr,
proshade_signed  xT,
proshade_signed  yT,
proshade_signed  zT,
proshade_unsign  inputO 
)

Constructor for creating ProSHADE_data structure with data.

This constructor creates a data structure with all the map information, so that maps obtained from other software could be loeaded and used. This function makes a lot of assumptions (all angles are 90 degrees, axis grids are equal to indices, axis order is XYZ and axis origin is the first index in all dimensions). If any of these are not true, the user is required to change the appropriate internal values after this function has returned the object.

Parameters
[in]settingsProSHADE_settings object specifying what should be done.
[in]strNameThe name of the structure for reference.
[in]mapValsA pointer to array where all the map data are.
[in]lenThe length of this map values array.
[in]xDmSzThe size of the x-axis dimension in Angstroms.
[in]yDmSzThe size of the y-axis dimension in Angstroms.
[in]zDmSzThe size of the z-axis dimension in Angstroms.
[in]xDmIndThe size of the x-axis dimension in indices.
[in]yDmIndThe size of the y-axis dimension in indices.
[in]zDmIndThe size of the z-axis dimension in indices.
[in]xFrThe first index statting position along the x-axis.
[in]yFrThe first index statting position along the y-axis.
[in]zFrThe first index statting position along the z-axis.
[in]xTThe last index end position along the x-axis.
[in]yTThe last index end position along the y-axis.
[in]zTThe last index end position along the z-axis.
[in]inputOThe input order for this structure.
[out]XEmpty data object with filled in values and map.

Definition at line 148 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

163  this->bAngle = 90.0;

167  this->zDimIndices = zDmInd;

169  this->yGridIndices = yDmInd;

173  this->zAxisOrder = 3;

175  this->yAxisOrigin = yFr;
176  this->zAxisOrigin = zFr;

179  this->comMovZ = 0.0;

182  this->zCom = 0.0;

187  this->zDimSizeOriginal = 0.0;
188  this->xDimIndicesOriginal = 0;
189  this->yDimIndicesOriginal = 0;

193  this->zAxisOriginOriginal = 0;

199  this->mapPostRotZCom = 0.0;

202  this->xFrom = xFr;
203  this->yFrom = yFr;
204  this->zFrom = zFr;
205  this->xTo = xT;
206  this->yTo = yT;
207  this->zTo = zT;
208 
209  // ... Variables regarding SH mapping spheres
210  this->spherePos = std::vector<proshade_single> ( );
211  this->noSpheres = 0;
212  this->spheres = NULL;
213  this->sphericalHarmonics = NULL;
214  this->rotSphericalHarmonics = NULL;
215  this->maxShellBand = 0;
216 
217  // ... Variables regarding shape distance computations
218  this->rrpMatrices = NULL;
219  this->eMatrices = NULL;
220  this->so3Coeffs = NULL;
221  this->so3CoeffsInverse = NULL;
222  this->wignerMatrices = NULL;
223  this->integrationWeight = 0.0;
224  this->maxCompBand = 0;
225  this->translationMap = NULL;
226 
227  // ... Control variables
228  this->isEmpty = false;
229  this->inputOrder = inputO;
230 
231  //================================================ Sanity checks
232  if ( static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( len ) != ( xDmInd * yDmInd * zDmInd ) )
233  {
234  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Structure class input map has wrong dimensions.", "EP00043", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "The supplied map array size has different dimensions to\n : the required map dimensions." );
235  }
236 
237  if ( ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( xT - xFr ) != static_cast<proshade_signed> ( xDmInd - 1 ) ) ||
238  ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( yT - yFr ) != static_cast<proshade_signed> ( yDmInd - 1 ) ) ||
239  ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( zT - zFr ) != static_cast<proshade_signed> ( zDmInd - 1 ) ) )
240  {
241  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Structure class input dimensions not in line with map\n : to/from indices.", "EP00044", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "The supplied map information does not add up. The\n : dimensions are not in line with the indexing start/stop\n : position distances and therefore proper map indexing\n : cannot be done. Please check the input values." );
242  }
243 
244  //================================================ Allocate the map memory
245  this->internalMap = new proshade_double [this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
246  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->internalMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
247 
248  //================================================ Copy the values into the map
249  proshade_unsign arrPos = 0;
250  for ( proshade_unsign xIt = 0; xIt < this->xDimIndices; xIt++ )
251  {
252  for ( proshade_unsign yIt = 0; yIt < this->yDimIndices; yIt++ )
253  {
254  for ( proshade_unsign zIt = 0; zIt < this->zDimIndices; zIt++ )
255  {
256  arrPos = zIt + this->zDimIndices * ( yIt + this->yDimIndices * xIt );
257  this->internalMap[arrPos] = static_cast<proshade_double> ( mapVals[arrPos] );
258  }
259  }
260  }
261 
262  //================================================ Done
263 
264 }

◆ ~ProSHADE_data()

ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::~ProSHADE_data ( void  )

Destructor for the ProSHADE_data class.

This destructor is responsible for releasing all memory used by the data storing object

Parameters
[out]XN/A.

Definition at line 272 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

273 {
274  //================================================ Release the internal map
275  if ( this->internalMap != NULL )
276  {
277  delete[] this->internalMap;
278  }
279 
280  //================================================ Release the sphere mapping
281  if ( this->spheres != NULL )
282  {
283  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->noSpheres; iter++ )
284  {
285  if ( this->spheres[iter] != NULL )
286  {
287  delete this->spheres[iter];
288  this->spheres[iter] = NULL;
289  }
290  }
291  delete[] this->spheres;
292  }
293 
294  //================================================ Release the spherical harmonics
295  if ( this->sphericalHarmonics != NULL )
296  {
297  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->noSpheres; iter++ )
298  {
299  if ( this->sphericalHarmonics[iter] != NULL )
300  {
301  delete[] this->sphericalHarmonics[iter];
302  this->sphericalHarmonics[iter] = NULL;
303  }
304  }
305  delete[] this->sphericalHarmonics;
306  }
307 
308  //================================================ Release the rotated spherical harmonics
309  if ( this->rotSphericalHarmonics != NULL )
310  {
311  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->noSpheres; iter++ )
312  {
313  if ( this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter] != NULL )
314  {
315  delete[] this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter];
316  this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter] = NULL;
317  }
318  }
319  delete[] this->rotSphericalHarmonics;
320  }
321 
322  //================================================ Release the RRP matrices (pre-computation for the energy levels descriptor)
323  if ( this->rrpMatrices != NULL )
324  {
325  for ( proshade_unsign bwIt = 0; bwIt < this->maxShellBand; bwIt++ )
326  {
327  if ( this->rrpMatrices[bwIt] != NULL )
328  {
329  for ( proshade_unsign shIt = 0; shIt < this->noSpheres; shIt++ )
330  {
331  if ( this->rrpMatrices[bwIt][shIt] != NULL )
332  {
333  delete[] this->rrpMatrices[bwIt][shIt];
334  }
335  }
336 
337  delete[] this->rrpMatrices[bwIt];
338  }
339  }
340 
341  delete[] this->rrpMatrices;
342  }
343 
344  //================================================ Release the E matrices
345  if ( this->eMatrices != NULL )
346  {
347  for ( proshade_unsign bandIter = 0; bandIter < this->maxCompBand; bandIter++ )
348  {
349  if ( this->eMatrices[bandIter] != NULL )
350  {
351  for ( proshade_unsign band2Iter = 0; band2Iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ( bandIter * 2 ) + 1 ); band2Iter++ )
352  {
353  if ( this->eMatrices[bandIter][band2Iter] != NULL )
354  {
355  delete[] this->eMatrices[bandIter][band2Iter];
356  }
357  }
358 
359  delete[] this->eMatrices[bandIter];
360  }
361  }
362 
363  delete[] this->eMatrices;
364  }
365 
366  //================================================ Release SOFT and inverse SOFT coefficients
367  if ( this->so3Coeffs != NULL )
368  {
369  delete[] this->so3Coeffs;
370  }
371  if ( this->so3CoeffsInverse != NULL )
372  {
373  delete[] this->so3CoeffsInverse;
374  }
375 
376  //================================================ Release Wigner matrices
377  if ( this->wignerMatrices != NULL )
378  {
379  for ( proshade_unsign bandIter = 1; bandIter < this->maxCompBand; bandIter++ )
380  {
381  if ( this->wignerMatrices[bandIter] != NULL )
382  {
383  for ( proshade_unsign order1Iter = 0; order1Iter < ( (bandIter * 2) + 1 ); order1Iter++ )
384  {
385  if ( this->wignerMatrices[bandIter][order1Iter] != NULL )
386  {
387  delete[] this->wignerMatrices[bandIter][order1Iter];
388  }
389  }
390  delete[] this->wignerMatrices[bandIter];
391  }
392  }
393  delete[] wignerMatrices;
394  }
395 
396  //================================================ Release translation map
397  if ( this->translationMap != NULL )
398  {
399  delete[] this->translationMap;
400  }
401 
402  //================================================ Done
403 
404 }

Member Function Documentation

◆ addExtraSpace()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::addExtraSpace ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function increases the size of the map so that it can add empty space around it.

This function adds a given number of angstroms (as given in the settings object) to the internal structure map. This requires all the internal variables to be adjusted for the extra space at the begginning and at the end, while also copying the map into a larger one with appropriate extra space.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

Definition at line 1514 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1515 {
1516  //================================================ Report function start
1517  std::stringstream hlpSS;
1518  hlpSS << "Adding extra " << settings->addExtraSpace << " angstroms.";
1519  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, hlpSS.str() );
1520 
1521  //================================================ Figure how much indices need to change
1522  proshade_unsign xAddIndices = ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::myRound ( settings->addExtraSpace / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->xDimSize / this->xDimIndices ) );
1523  proshade_unsign yAddIndices = ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::myRound ( settings->addExtraSpace / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->yDimSize / this->yDimIndices ) );
1524  proshade_unsign zAddIndices = ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::myRound ( settings->addExtraSpace / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->zDimSize / this->zDimIndices ) );
1525 
1526  //================================================ Update internal data variables
1527  this->xDimSize += static_cast<proshade_single> ( 2 * xAddIndices ) * static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->xDimSize / this->xDimIndices );
1528  this->yDimSize += static_cast<proshade_single> ( 2 * yAddIndices ) * static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->yDimSize / this->yDimIndices );
1529  this->zDimSize += static_cast<proshade_single> ( 2 * zAddIndices ) * static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->zDimSize / this->zDimIndices );
1530 
1531  this->xDimIndices += 2 * xAddIndices;
1532  this->yDimIndices += 2 * yAddIndices;
1533  this->zDimIndices += 2 * zAddIndices;
1534 
1535  this->xGridIndices = this->xDimIndices;
1536  this->yGridIndices = this->yDimIndices;
1537  this->zGridIndices = this->zDimIndices;
1538 
1539  this->xAxisOrigin -= xAddIndices;
1540  this->yAxisOrigin -= yAddIndices;
1541  this->zAxisOrigin -= zAddIndices;
1542 
1543  this->xFrom -= xAddIndices;
1544  this->yFrom -= yAddIndices;
1545  this->zFrom -= zAddIndices;
1546 
1547  this->xTo += xAddIndices;
1548  this->yTo += yAddIndices;
1549  this->zTo += zAddIndices;
1550 
1551  //================================================ Allocate new map
1552  proshade_double* newMap = new proshade_double[this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
1553  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( newMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
1554 
1555  //================================================ Set new map to zeroes
1556  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
1557  {
1558  newMap[iter] = 0.0;
1559  }
1560 
1561  //================================================ Update the map
1562  proshade_unsign newMapIndex, oldMapIndex;
1563  for ( proshade_unsign xIt = 0; xIt < (this->xDimIndices - xAddIndices); xIt++ )
1564  {
1565  //============================================ Check if point is applicable
1566  if ( xIt < xAddIndices ) { continue; }
1567 
1568  for ( proshade_unsign yIt = 0; yIt < (this->yDimIndices - yAddIndices); yIt++ )
1569  {
1570  //======================================== Check if point is applicable
1571  if ( yIt < yAddIndices ) { continue; }
1572 
1573  for ( proshade_unsign zIt = 0; zIt < (this->zDimIndices - zAddIndices); zIt++ )
1574  {
1575  //==================================== Check if point is applicable
1576  if ( zIt < zAddIndices ) { continue; }
1577 
1578  //==================================== Var init
1579  newMapIndex = zIt + this->zDimIndices * ( yIt + this->yDimIndices * xIt );
1580  oldMapIndex = (zIt - zAddIndices) + (this->zDimIndices - ( 2 * zAddIndices ) ) * ( (yIt - yAddIndices) + (this->yDimIndices - ( 2 * yAddIndices ) ) * (xIt - xAddIndices) );
1581 
1582  newMap[newMapIndex] = this->internalMap[oldMapIndex];
1583  }
1584  }
1585  }
1586 
1587  //================================================ Copy new to old
1588  delete[] this->internalMap;
1589 
1590  this->internalMap = new proshade_double[this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
1591  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->internalMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
1592 
1593  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
1594  {
1595  this->internalMap[iter] = newMap[iter];
1596  }
1597 
1598  //================================================ Release memory
1599  delete[] newMap;
1600 
1601  //================================================ Report function completion
1602  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Extra space added." );
1603 
1604  //================================================ Done
1605  return ;
1606 
1607 }

◆ allocateEMatrices()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::allocateEMatrices ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
proshade_unsign  band 
)

This function allocates the required memory for the E matrices.

This function belongs to the ProSHADE_data class and its role is to allocate the require memory for the E matrices required by both, the Trace Sigma and Full Rotational descriptors, as well as symmetry and rotation tasks.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for the task.
[in]bandThe minimal band of the comparison for which E matrices are computed.

Definition at line 280 of file ProSHADE_distances.cpp.

281 {
282  //================================================ Save the maximum band to the object
283  this->maxCompBand = band;
284 
285  //================================================ Allocate the required memory
286  this->eMatrices = new proshade_complex** [this->maxCompBand];
287  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->eMatrices, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
288 
289  for ( proshade_unsign bandIter = 0; bandIter < this->maxCompBand; bandIter++ )
290  {
291  //============================================ Allocate the data structure
292  this->eMatrices[bandIter] = new proshade_complex* [static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ( bandIter * 2 ) + 1 )];
293  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->eMatrices[bandIter], __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
294 
295  for ( proshade_unsign band2Iter = 0; band2Iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ( bandIter * 2 ) + 1 ); band2Iter++ )
296  {
297  this->eMatrices[bandIter][band2Iter] = new proshade_complex [static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ( bandIter * 2 ) + 1 )];
298  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->eMatrices[bandIter][band2Iter], __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
299  }
300  }
301 
302  //================================================ Done
303  return ;

305 }

◆ allocateRotatedSHMemory()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::allocateRotatedSHMemory ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function allocates the memory required for storing the rotated Spherical Harmonics coefficients.

Parameters
[in]settingsThe settings object specifying how exactly the rotation is to be done.

Definition at line 703 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

704 {
705  //================================================ Allocate the main pointer and check
706  this->rotSphericalHarmonics = new proshade_complex* [this->noSpheres];
707  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->rotSphericalHarmonics, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
708 
709  //================================================ For each sphere
710  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->noSpheres; iter++ )
711  {
712  //============================================ Allocate the sphere storage space
713  this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter] = new proshade_complex [static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( pow ( (this->spheres[iter]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2), 2) )];
714  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter], __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
715 
716  //============================================ Set values to zeroes
717  for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( pow ( (this->spheres[iter]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2), 2) ); it++ )
718  {
719  this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter][it][0] = 0.0;
720  this->rotSphericalHarmonics[iter][it][1] = 0.0;
721  }
722  }
723 
724  //================================================ Done
725  return ;

◆ allocateRRPMemory()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::allocateRRPMemory ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)
protected

This function allocates the required memory for the RRP matrices.

This function belongs to the ProSHADE_data class and its role is to allocate the require memory for the RRP matrices, given the already determined bandwidths and shell count.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for the task.

Definition at line 33 of file ProSHADE_distances.cpp.

34 {
35  //================================================ Allocate the required memory
36  this->rrpMatrices = new proshade_double** [this->maxShellBand];
37  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->rrpMatrices, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
38 
39  for ( proshade_unsign bwIt = 0; bwIt < this->maxShellBand; bwIt++ )
40  {
41  //============================================ For rach sphere
42  this->rrpMatrices[bwIt] = new proshade_double* [this->noSpheres];
43  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->rrpMatrices[bwIt], __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
44 
45  for ( proshade_unsign shIt = 0; shIt < this->noSpheres; shIt++ )
46  {
47  this->rrpMatrices[bwIt][shIt] = new double [this->noSpheres];
48  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->rrpMatrices[bwIt][shIt], __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
49  }
50  }
51 }

◆ centreMapOnCOM()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::centreMapOnCOM ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function shits the map so that its COM is in the centre of the map.

This function finds the Centre Of Mass (COM) for the internal map and proceeds to use Fourier to shift the COM to the centre of the map. There is an assumption that the COM and centre of map are close, as if they were far apart, the shift could move some part of the map through the boundaries and cause the map to become messy.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

Definition at line 1448 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1449 {
1450  //================================================ Report function start
1451  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Centering map onto its COM." );
1452 
1453  //================================================ Initialise local variables
1454  proshade_unsign arrPos = 0;
1455  proshade_single xCOM = 0.0;
1456  proshade_single yCOM = 0.0;
1457  proshade_single zCOM = 0.0;
1458  proshade_single totDens = 0.0;
1459 
1460  //================================================ Find the COM location
1461  for ( proshade_unsign xIt = 0; xIt < this->xDimIndices; xIt++ )
1462  {
1463  for ( proshade_unsign yIt = 0; yIt < this->yDimIndices; yIt++ )
1464  {
1465  for ( proshade_unsign zIt = 0; zIt < this->zDimIndices; zIt++ )
1466  {
1467  //==================================== Get index
1468  arrPos = zIt + this->zDimIndices * ( yIt + this->yDimIndices * xIt );
1469 
1470  //==================================== Get COM
1471  if ( this->internalMap[arrPos] > 0.0 )
1472  {
1473  xCOM += static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->internalMap[arrPos] * xIt );
1474  yCOM += static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->internalMap[arrPos] * yIt );
1475  zCOM += static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->internalMap[arrPos] * zIt );
1476  totDens += static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->internalMap[arrPos] );
1477  }
1478  }
1479  }
1480  }
1481  xCOM /= totDens;
1482  yCOM /= totDens;
1483  zCOM /= totDens;
1484 
1485  //================================================ Find distance from COM to map centre in Angstroms
1486  proshade_single xDist = ( static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->xDimIndices / 2.0 ) - xCOM ) * static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->xDimSize / this->xDimIndices );
1487  proshade_single yDist = ( static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->yDimIndices / 2.0 ) - yCOM ) * static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->yDimSize / this->yDimIndices );
1488  proshade_single zDist = ( static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->zDimIndices / 2.0 ) - zCOM ) * static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->zDimSize / this->zDimIndices );
1489 
1490  //================================================ Save COM movement
1491  this->comMovX = static_cast<proshade_double> ( xDist );
1492  this->comMovY = static_cast<proshade_double> ( yDist );
1493  this->comMovZ = static_cast<proshade_double> ( zDist );
1494 
1495  //================================================ Move the map within the box
1496  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::moveMapByFourier ( this->internalMap, xDist, yDist, zDist, this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize, this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices );
1497 
1498  //================================================ Report function completion
1499  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Map centered." );
1500 
1501  //================================================ Done
1502  return ;
1503 
1504 }

◆ computeRotatedSH()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::computeRotatedSH ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function multiplies the objects spherical harmonics with the Wigner D matrices, obtaining rotated spherical harmonics coefficients.

Parameters
[in]settingsThe settings object specifying how exactly the rotation is to be done.

Definition at line 733 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

734 {
735  //================================================ Initialise variables
736  proshade_double WigDR, WigDI, *ShR, *ShI, retR, retI;
737  proshade_unsign arrPos;
738 
739  //================================================ Compute
740  for ( proshade_signed shell = 0; shell < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->noSpheres ); shell++ )
741  {
742  //============================================ For each band
743  for ( proshade_signed bandIter = 0; bandIter < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth() ); bandIter++ )
744  {
745  //======================================== For each order1
746  for ( proshade_signed order1 = 0; order1 < ( ( bandIter * 2 ) + 1 ); order1++ )
747  {
748  //==================================== Get Spherical Harmonics value
749  ShR = getRealSphHarmValue ( bandIter, order1, shell );
750  ShI = getImagSphHarmValue ( bandIter, order1, shell );
751 
752  //==================================== For each order2
753  for ( proshade_signed order2 = 0; order2 < ( ( bandIter * 2 ) + 1 ); order2++ )
754  {
755  //================================ Get Wigner D values
756  this->getWignerMatrixValue ( bandIter, order1, order2, &WigDR, &WigDI );
757 
758  //================================ Multiply SH and Wigner
759  ProSHADE_internal_maths::complexMultiplication ( ShR, ShI, &WigDR, &WigDI, &retR, &retI );
760 
761  //================================ Save
762  arrPos = static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( seanindex ( order2-bandIter, bandIter, this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth() ) );
763  this->rotSphericalHarmonics[shell][arrPos][0] += retR;
764  this->rotSphericalHarmonics[shell][arrPos][1] += retI;
765  }
766  }
767  }
768  }
769 
770  //================================================ Done
771  return ;
772 
773 }

◆ computeRRPMatrices()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::computeRRPMatrices ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function pre-computes the RRP matrices for a data object.

This function belongs to the ProSHADE_data class and its role is to set the objects internal variables properly and provide all the required calculations, so that the object will in the end have all the RRP matrices computed and be ready for the energy levels calculation.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for the task.

Definition at line 61 of file ProSHADE_distances.cpp.

62 {
63  //================================================ Report progress
64  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Computing RRP matrices for structure " + this->fileName );
65 
66  //================================================ Allocate the memory
67  this->allocateRRPMemory ( settings );
68 
69  //================================================ Start computation: For each band (l)
70  proshade_double descValR = 0.0;
71  proshade_unsign arrPos1, arrPos2;
72  for ( proshade_unsign band = 0; band < this->maxShellBand; band++ )
73  {
74  //============================================ For each unique shell couple
75  for ( proshade_unsign shell1 = 0; shell1 < this->noSpheres; shell1++ )
76  {
77  //======================================== Does the band exist for this shell1?
78  if ( !ProSHADE_internal_distances::isBandWithinShell ( band, shell1, this->spheres ) )
79  {
80  for ( proshade_unsign shell2 = 0; shell2 < this->noSpheres; shell2++ )
81  {
82  this->rrpMatrices[band][shell1][shell2] = 0.0;
83  this->rrpMatrices[band][shell2][shell1] = 0.0;
84  }
85  continue;
86  }
87 
88  for ( proshade_unsign shell2 = 0; shell2 < this->noSpheres; shell2++ )
89  {
90  //==================================== Compute each values only once
91  if ( shell1 > shell2 ) { continue; }
92 
93  //==================================== Check if band exists for this shell2?
94  if ( !ProSHADE_internal_distances::isBandWithinShell ( band, shell2, this->spheres ) )
95  {
96  this->rrpMatrices[band][shell1][shell2] = 0.0;
97  this->rrpMatrices[band][shell2][shell1] = 0.0;
98  continue;
99  }
100 
101  //==================================== Initialise
102  descValR = 0.0;
103 
104  //==================================== Sum over order (m)
105  for ( proshade_unsign order = 0; order < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ( 2 * band ) + 1 ); order++ )
106  {
107  arrPos1 = static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( seanindex ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( order ) -
108  static_cast<proshade_signed> ( band ),
109  band, this->spheres[shell1]->getLocalBandwidth() ) );
110  arrPos2 = static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( seanindex ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( order ) -
111  static_cast<proshade_signed> ( band ),
112  band, this->spheres[shell2]->getLocalBandwidth() ) );
113  descValR += ProSHADE_internal_maths::complexMultiplicationConjugRealOnly ( &this->sphericalHarmonics[shell1][arrPos1][0],
114  &this->sphericalHarmonics[shell1][arrPos1][1],
115  &this->sphericalHarmonics[shell2][arrPos2][0],
116  &this->sphericalHarmonics[shell2][arrPos2][1] );
117  }
118 
119  //==================================== Save the matrices
120  this->rrpMatrices[band][shell1][shell2] = descValR;
121  this->rrpMatrices[band][shell2][shell1] = descValR;
122  }
123  }
124  }
125 
126  //================================================ Report progress
127  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 3, "RRP matrices successfully computed." );
128 
129  //================================================ Done
130  return ;
131 
132 }

◆ computeSphericalHarmonics()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::computeSphericalHarmonics ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function computes the spherical harmonics decomposition for the whole structure.

This function is called to compute the spherical harmonics decomposition of the mapped data on every available sphere. This is done sphere-wise and there is some sub-optimal memory management stemming from different shells having different resolutions.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

Definition at line 1758 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1759 {
1760  //================================================ Report progress
1761  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting spherical harmonics decomposition." );
1762 
1763  //================================================ Initialise memory
1764  this->sphericalHarmonics = new proshade_complex* [this->noSpheres];
1765  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->sphericalHarmonics, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
1766  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->noSpheres; iter++ )
1767  {
1768  this->sphericalHarmonics[iter] = new proshade_complex [(this->spheres[iter]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2) * (this->spheres[iter]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2)];
1769  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( this->sphericalHarmonics[iter], __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
1770  }
1771 
1772  //================================================ Compute the spherical harmonics
1773  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->noSpheres; iter++ )
1774  {
1775  //============================================ Report progress
1776  std::stringstream ss;
1777  ss << "Now decomposing sphere " << iter << ". " << "( Band is: " << this->spheres[iter]->getLocalBandwidth() << ").";
1778  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 4, ss.str() );
1779 
1780  //============================================ Compute
1781  ProSHADE_internal_sphericalHarmonics::computeSphericalHarmonics ( this->spheres[iter]->getLocalBandwidth(), this->spheres[iter]->getMappedData(), this->sphericalHarmonics[iter] );
1782  }
1783 
1784  //================================================ Report completion
1785  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Spherical harmonics decomposition complete." );
1786 
1787  //======================================== Done
1788  return ;
1789 
1790 }

◆ computeTranslationMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::computeTranslationMap ( ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data *  staticStructure)

This function does the computation of the translation map.

This function takes the static structure, the optimal translation to which should be found and then it proceeds to compute the Fourier transform of both this and the static structures. It then combines the coefficients for translation function and computes the inverse Fourier transform, thus obtaining the translation function. This function is then saved, while all other internal data are deleted.

Parameters
[in]staticStructureA pointer to the data class object of the other ( static ) structure.

Definition at line 274 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

275 {
276  //================================================ Do this using Fourier!
277  fftw_complex *tmpIn1 = NULL, *tmpOut1 = NULL, *tmpIn2 = NULL, *tmpOut2 = NULL, *resOut = NULL;
278  fftw_plan forwardFourierObj1, forwardFourierObj2, inverseFourierCombo;
279  proshade_unsign dimMult = staticStructure->getXDim() * staticStructure->getYDim() * staticStructure->getZDim();
280  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::allocateTranslationFunctionMemory ( tmpIn1, tmpOut1, tmpIn2, tmpOut2, this->translationMap, resOut, forwardFourierObj1, forwardFourierObj2, inverseFourierCombo, staticStructure->getXDim(), staticStructure->getYDim(), staticStructure->getZDim() );
281 
282  //================================================ Fill in input data
283  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < dimMult; iter++ ) { tmpIn1[iter][0] = staticStructure->getMapValue ( iter ); tmpIn1[iter][1] = 0.0; }
284  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < dimMult; iter++ ) { tmpIn2[iter][0] = this->getMapValue ( iter ); tmpIn2[iter][1] = 0.0; }
285 
286  //================================================ Calculate Fourier
287  fftw_execute ( forwardFourierObj1 );
288  fftw_execute ( forwardFourierObj2 );
289 
290  //================================================ Combine Fourier coeffs and invert
291  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::combineFourierForTranslation ( tmpOut1, tmpOut2, resOut, staticStructure->getXDim(), staticStructure->getYDim(), staticStructure->getZDim() );
292  fftw_execute ( inverseFourierCombo );
293 
294  //================================================ Free memory
295  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::freeTranslationFunctionMemory ( tmpIn1, tmpOut1, tmpIn2, tmpOut2, resOut, forwardFourierObj1, forwardFourierObj2, inverseFourierCombo );
296 
297  //================================================ Done
298  return ;
299 
300 }

◆ createNewMapFromBounds()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::createNewMapFromBounds ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
ProSHADE_data *&  newStr,
proshade_signed *  newBounds 
)

This function creates a new structure from the calling structure and new bounds values.

This function takes a pointer to uninitialised structure and fills it with the calling structure values adjusted for the new bounds. If the bounds are the same, the two structures should be identical except the file (the new structure does not have an input file associated) and the type (no type for the new structure). It can deal with both larger and smaller bounds than the original values.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.
[in]newStrA pointer reference to a new structure class which has all the same values except for the new bounds and adequately changed map.
[in]newBoundsA pointer to proshade_signed array of 6 storing the results - (0 = minX; 1 = maxX; 2 = minY; 3 = maxY; 4 - minZ; 5 = maxZ).

Definition at line 1252 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1253 {
1254  //================================================ Report function start
1255  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Creating new structure according to the new bounds." );
1256 
1257  //================================================ Fill in basic info
1258  newStr->fileName = "N/A";
1259  newStr->fileType = ProSHADE_internal_io::MAP;
1260 
1261  //================================================ Fill in new structure values
1262  newStr->xDimIndices = static_cast<proshade_signed> ( newBounds[1] ) - static_cast<proshade_signed> ( newBounds[0] ) + 1;
1263  newStr->yDimIndices = static_cast<proshade_signed> ( newBounds[3] ) - static_cast<proshade_signed> ( newBounds[2] ) + 1;
1264  newStr->zDimIndices = static_cast<proshade_signed> ( newBounds[5] ) - static_cast<proshade_signed> ( newBounds[4] ) + 1;

1271  newStr->yDimSize = static_cast<proshade_single> ( newStr->yDimIndices ) * ( this->yDimSize / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->yDimIndices ) );
1272  newStr->zDimSize = static_cast<proshade_single> ( newStr->zDimIndices ) * ( this->zDimSize / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->zDimIndices ) );
1273

1287  newStr->yFrom = this->yFrom + newBounds[2];
1288  newStr->zFrom = this->zFrom + newBounds[4];
1289 
1290  newStr->xTo = this->xTo - ( (this->xDimIndices-1) - newBounds[1] );
1291  newStr->yTo = this->yTo - ( (this->yDimIndices-1) - newBounds[3] );
1292  newStr->zTo = this->zTo - ( (this->zDimIndices-1) - newBounds[5] );
1293 
1294  //================================================ Allocate new structure map
1295  newStr->internalMap = new proshade_double[newStr->xDimIndices * newStr->yDimIndices * newStr->zDimIndices];
1296  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( newStr->internalMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
1297 
1298  //================================================ Copy the map
1299  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::copyMapByBounds ( newStr->xFrom, newStr->xTo, newStr->yFrom, newStr->yTo, newStr->zFrom, newStr->zTo,
1300  this->xFrom, this->yFrom, this->zFrom, newStr->yDimIndices, newStr->zDimIndices,
1301  this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices, newStr->internalMap, this->internalMap );
1302 
1303  //================================================ Report function completion
1304  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "New structure created." );
1305 
1306  //================================================ Done
1307  return ;

1309 }

◆ createNewMapFromBoundsPy()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::createNewMapFromBoundsPy ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
ProSHADE_data *  newStr,
int *  newBounds,
int  len 
)

This function creates a new structure from the calling structure and new bounds values in Python friendly format.

This function takes a pointer to uninitialised structure and fills it with the calling structure values adjusted for the new bounds. If the bounds are the same, the two structures should be identical except the file (the new structure does not have an input file associated) and the type (no type for the new structure). It can deal with both larger and smaller bounds than the original values. This version of the function is identical to the createNewMapFromBounds() function, but it takes the input boundaries in Python friendly fassion.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.
[in]newStrA pointer reference to a new structure class which has all the same values except for the new bounds and adequately changed map.
[in]newBoundsA pointer to proshade_signed array of 6 storing the results - (0 = minX; 1 = maxX; 2 = minY; 3 = maxY; 4 - minZ; 5 = maxZ).
[in]lenThe length of the newBounds array - this must always be 6, but Swig/Numpy requires this number to be passed.

1349 
1350  newStr->xAxisOrder = this->xAxisOrder;
1351  newStr->yAxisOrder = this->yAxisOrder;
1352  newStr->zAxisOrder = this->zAxisOrder;
1353 
1354  newStr->xAxisOrigin = this->xAxisOrigin + newBounds[0];
1355  newStr->yAxisOrigin = this->yAxisOrigin + newBounds[2];
1356  newStr->zAxisOrigin = this->zAxisOrigin + newBounds[4];
1357 
1358  newStr->xFrom = this->xFrom + newBounds[0];
1359  newStr->yFrom = this->yFrom + newBounds[2];
1360  newStr->zFrom = this->zFrom + newBounds[4];
1361 
1362  newStr->xTo = this->xTo - ( (this->xDimIndices-1) - newBounds[1] );
1363  newStr->yTo = this->yTo - ( (this->yDimIndices-1) - newBounds[3] );
1364  newStr->zTo = this->zTo - ( (this->zDimIndices-1) - newBounds[5] );
1365 
1366  //================================================ Allocate new structure map
1367  newStr->internalMap = new proshade_double[newStr->xDimIndices * newStr->yDimIndices * newStr->zDimIndices];
1368  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( newStr->internalMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
1369 
1370  //================================================ Copy the map
1371  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::copyMapByBounds ( newStr->xFrom, newStr->xTo, newStr->yFrom, newStr->yTo, newStr->zFrom, newStr->zTo,
1372  this->xFrom, this->yFrom, this->zFrom, newStr->yDimIndices, newStr->zDimIndices,
1373  this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices, newStr->internalMap, this->internalMap );
1374 
1375  //================================================ Report function completion
1376  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "New structure created." );
1377 
1378  //================================================ Done
1379  return ;
1380 
1381 }

◆ deepCopyMap()

)

This function copies the internal map into the supplied pointer, which it also allocates.

This function is provided so that the user can provide a pointer and have it allocated and filled with the map values.

Parameters
[in]saveToA pointer where the internal map should be deep copied into.
[in]verboseHow loud the run should be?

Definition at line 2274 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2281  }

2284  saveTo = new proshade_double[this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
2285 
2286  //================================================ Check memory allocation
2287  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( saveTo, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
2288

2290  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )

◆ detectSymmetryInStructure()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::detectSymmetryInStructure ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  axes 
)

This function runs the symmetry detection algorithms on this structure and saves the results in the settings object.

This function is the symmetry detection starting point. It decides whether a specific symmetry is being sought after, or whether a general symmetry search is required. Consequently, it calls the appropriate functions and ends up with saving the resulting predictions into the settings object supplied.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map symmetry detection.
[in]axesA vector to which all the axes of the recommended symmetry (if any) will be saved.

Definition at line 1801 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1802 {
1803  //================================================ Initialise variables
1804  std::vector< proshade_double* > CSyms;
1805 
1806  //================================================ Was any particular symmetry requested?
1807  if ( settings->requestedSymmetryType == "" )
1808  {
1809  //============================================ Run the symmetry detection functions for C, D, T, O and I symmetries
1810  CSyms = this->getCyclicSymmetriesList ( settings );
1811  std::vector< proshade_double* > DSyms = this->getDihedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms );
1812  std::vector< proshade_double* > ISyms = this->getIcosahedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms );
1813  std::vector< proshade_double* > OSyms; std::vector< proshade_double* > TSyms;
1814  if ( ISyms.size() < 31 ) { OSyms = this->getOctahedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms ); if ( OSyms.size() < 13 ) { TSyms = this->getTetrahedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms ); } }
1815 
1816  //============================================ Decide on recommended symmetry
1817  this->saveRecommendedSymmetry ( settings, &CSyms, &DSyms, &TSyms, &OSyms, &ISyms, axes );
1818  }
1819 
1820  if ( settings->requestedSymmetryType == "C" )
1821  {
1822  //============================================ Run only the C symmetry detection and search for requested fold
1823  CSyms = this->getCyclicSymmetriesList ( settings );
1824  this->saveRequestedSymmetryC ( settings, &CSyms, axes );
1825  }
1826 
1827  if ( settings->requestedSymmetryType == "D" )
1828  {
1829  //============================================ Run only the D symmetry detection and search for requested fold
1830  CSyms = this->getCyclicSymmetriesList ( settings );
1831  std::vector< proshade_double* > DSyms = this->getDihedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms );
1832  this->saveRequestedSymmetryD ( settings, &DSyms, axes );
1833  }
1834 
1835  if ( settings->requestedSymmetryType == "T" )
1836  {
1837  //============================================ Run only the T symmetry detection and search for requested fold
1838  CSyms = this->getCyclicSymmetriesList ( settings );
1839  std::vector< proshade_double* > TSyms = this->getTetrahedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms );
1840  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
1841  if ( TSyms.size() == 7 ) { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "T" ); for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( TSyms.size() ); it++ ) { settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( TSyms.at(it) ); ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, TSyms.at(it) ); } }
1842  else { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "" ); }
1843  }
1844 
1845  if ( settings->requestedSymmetryType == "O" )
1846  {
1847  //============================================ Run only the O symmetry detection and search for requested fold
1848  CSyms = this->getCyclicSymmetriesList ( settings );
1849  std::vector< proshade_double* > OSyms = this->getOctahedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms );
1850  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
1851  if ( OSyms.size() == 13 ) { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "O" ); for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( OSyms.size() ); it++ ) { settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( OSyms.at(it) ); ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, OSyms.at(it) ); } }
1852  else { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "" ); }
1853  }
1854 
1855  if ( settings->requestedSymmetryType == "I" )
1856  {
1857  //============================================ Run only the T symmetry detection and search for requested fold
1858  CSyms = this->getCyclicSymmetriesList ( settings );
1859  std::vector< proshade_double* > ISyms = this->getIcosahedralSymmetriesList ( settings, &CSyms );
1860  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
1861  if ( ISyms.size() == 31 ) { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "I" ); for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ISyms.size() ); it++ ) { settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( ISyms.at(it) ); ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, ISyms.at(it) ); } }
1862  else { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "" ); }
1863  }
1864 
1865  if ( ( settings->requestedSymmetryType != "" ) && ( settings->requestedSymmetryType != "C" ) && ( settings->requestedSymmetryType != "D" ) && ( settings->requestedSymmetryType != "T" ) && ( settings->requestedSymmetryType != "O" ) && ( settings->requestedSymmetryType != "I" ) )
1866  {
1867  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Requested symmetry supplied, but not recognised.", "ES00031", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "There are only the following value allowed for the\n : symmetry type request: \"C\", \"D\", \"T\", \"O\" and \"I\". Any\n : other value will result in this error." );
1868  }
1869 
1870  //================================================ Release memory
1871  for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( CSyms.size() ); it++ ) { delete[] CSyms.at(it); }
1872 
1873  //================================================ Done
1874  return ;
1875 
1876 }

This function runs the symmetry detection algorithms on this structure saving the axes in the settings object only.

This function runs the detectSymmetryInStructure() function without requiring the vector of double pointers arguments, so that it is simply callable from Python. The axes are saved in the settings object for later retrieval.

◆ findBestCScore()

proshade_double ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::findBestCScore ( std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSym,
proshade_unsign *  symInd 
)

This function locates the best scoring C symmetry axis, returning the score and best symmetry index.

This function takes the list of detected C symmetries and decides which of them is the best, taking into account the folds and the average heights. This is not the best approach, I would look into MLE of symmetry presence givent the height and fold, but for now this should do.

Parameters
[in]CSymThis is the complete list of the ProSHADE detected C axes in the ProSHADE format.
[in]symIndA pointer to variable where the best symmetry axis index will be stored.
[out]retThe score of the best scoring C axis.

Definition at line 1907 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1908 {
1909  //================================================ Sanity check
1910  if ( CSym->size() == 0 ) { *symInd = 0; return ( 0.0 ); }
1911 
1912  //================================================ Sort the vector
1913  std::sort ( CSym->begin(), CSym->end(), ProSHADE_internal_misc::sortSymHlpInv );
1914 
1915  //================================================ Initalise variables
1916  proshade_double ret = CSym->at(0)[5];
1917  *symInd = 0;
1918  proshade_double frac = 0.0;
1919 
1920  //================================================ Check all other axes
1921  for ( proshade_unsign ind = 1; ind < static_cast<proshade_unsign>( CSym->size() ); ind++ )
1922  {
1923  //============================================ If higher fold than already leading one (do not care for lower fold and lower average height axes)
1924  if ( CSym->at(ind)[0] > CSym->at(*symInd)[0] )
1925  {
1926  //======================================== How much higher fold is it? Also, adding some protection against large syms supported only by a subset and a minimum requirement.
1927  frac = std::max ( std::min ( ( CSym->at(*symInd)[0] / CSym->at(ind)[0] ) * 1.5, 0.9 ), 0.6 );
1928 
1929  //======================================== Check if the new is "better" according to this criteria.
1930  if ( ( CSym->at(*symInd)[5] * frac ) < CSym->at(ind)[5] )
1931  {
1932  //==================================== And it is! Save and try next one.
1933  *symInd = ind;
1934  ret = CSym->at(ind)[5];
1935  }
1936  }
1937  }
1938 
1939  //================================================ Done
1940  return ( ret );
1941 
1942 }

◆ findBestDScore()

proshade_double ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::findBestDScore ( std::vector< proshade_double * > *  DSym,
proshade_unsign *  symInd 
)

This function locates the best scoring D symmetry axis, returning the score and best symmetry index.

This function takes the list of detected D symmetries and decides which of them is the best, taking into account the folds and the average heights. This is not the best approach, I would look into MLE of symmetry presence givent the height and folds, but for now this should do.

Parameters
[in]DSymThis is the complete list of the ProSHADE detected D axes in the ProSHADE format.
[in]symIndA pointer to variable where the best symmetry axis index will be stored.
[out]retThe score of the best scoring D axis.

Definition at line 1953 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1954 {
1955  //================================================ Sort the vector
1956  std::sort ( DSym->begin(), DSym->end(), ProSHADE_internal_misc::sortDSymHlpInv );
1957 
1958  //================================================ Initalise variables
1959  proshade_double ret = 0.0;
1960  proshade_double frac = 0.0;
1961  if ( DSym->size() > 0 )
1962  {
1963  ret = ( ( DSym->at(0)[0] * DSym->at(0)[5] ) + ( DSym->at(0)[6] * DSym->at(0)[11] ) ) / ( DSym->at(0)[0] + DSym->at(0)[6] );
1964  *symInd = 0;
1965  }
1966  else { return ( ret ); }
1967 
1968  //================================================ Check all other axes
1969  for ( proshade_unsign ind = 1; ind < static_cast<proshade_unsign>( DSym->size() ); ind++ )
1970  {
1971  //============================================ If higher fold than already leading one (do not care for lower fold and lower average height axes)
1972  if ( ( DSym->at(ind)[0] + DSym->at(ind)[6] ) > ( DSym->at(*symInd)[0] + DSym->at(*symInd)[6] ) )
1973  {
1974  //======================================== How much higher fold is it? Also, adding some protection against large syms supported only by a subset and a minimum requirement.
1975  frac = std::max ( std::min ( ( ( DSym->at(*symInd)[0] + DSym->at(*symInd)[6] ) / ( DSym->at(ind)[0] + DSym->at(ind)[6] ) ) * 1.5, 0.9 ), 0.6 );
1976 
1977  //======================================== Check if the new is "better" according to this criteria.
1978  if ( ( ( ( DSym->at(*symInd)[0] * DSym->at(*symInd)[5] ) + ( DSym->at(*symInd)[6] * DSym->at(*symInd)[11] ) ) / ( DSym->at(*symInd)[0] + DSym->at(*symInd)[6] ) * frac ) < ( ( DSym->at(ind)[0] * DSym->at(ind)[5] ) + ( DSym->at(ind)[6] * DSym->at(ind)[11] ) ) / ( DSym->at(ind)[0] + DSym->at(ind)[6] ) )
1979  {
1980  //==================================== And it is! Save and try next one.
1981  *symInd = ind;
1982  ret = ( ( DSym->at(ind)[0] * DSym->at(ind)[5] ) + ( DSym->at(ind)[6] * DSym->at(ind)[11] ) ) / ( DSym->at(ind)[0] + DSym->at(ind)[6] );
1983  }
1984  }
1985  }
1986 
1987  //================================================ Done
1988  return ( ret );
1989 
1990 }

◆ findIScore()

proshade_double ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::findIScore ( std::vector< proshade_double * > *  ISym)

This function takes the list of icosahedral axes and returns a score for deciding whether I symmetry should be recommended.

This function simply checks if the complete I symmetry is present (returning 0.0 if not). If present, the function will compute the fold weighted average axis height for the whole symmetry and return this number.

Parameters
[in]ISymThis is the complete list of the ProSHADE detected I symmetry axes in the ProSHADE format.
[out]retThe score of the I symmetry.

Definition at line 2066 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2067 {
2068  //================================================ Initialise variables
2069  proshade_double ret = 0.0;
2070  proshade_double foldSum = 0.0;
2071 
2072  //================================================ Check the T symmetry for being complete
2073  if ( ISym->size() == 31 )
2074  {
2075  //============================================ Compute the weighted fold
2076  for ( proshade_unsign cIt = 0; cIt < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ISym->size() ); cIt++ )
2077  {
2078  ret += ISym->at(cIt)[0] * ISym->at(cIt)[5];
2079  foldSum += ISym->at(cIt)[0];
2080  }
2081 
2082  //============================================ Weight
2083  ret /= foldSum;
2084  }
2085 
2086  //================================================ Done
2087  return ( ret );
2088 
2089 }

◆ findMapCOM()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::findMapCOM ( )

This function finds the centre of mass of the internal map representation.

This function simply computes the centre of mass for the given ProSHADE_data object map in the "real space" (i.e. the space that counts Angstroms from the bottom left further corner). These are then saved into the ProSHADE_data object.

Definition at line 2355 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2356 {
2357  //================================================ Initialise variables
2358  this->xCom = 0.0;
2359  this->yCom = 0.0;
2360  this->zCom = 0.0;
2361  proshade_double totNonZeroPoints = 0.0;
2362  proshade_signed mapIt = 0;
2363 
2364  //================================================ Compute COM from 0 ; 0 ; 0
2365  for ( proshade_signed xIt = 0; xIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->xDimIndices ); xIt++ )
2366  {
2367  for ( proshade_signed yIt = 0; yIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->yDimIndices ); yIt++ )
2368  {
2369  for ( proshade_signed zIt = 0; zIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->zDimIndices ); zIt++ )
2370  {
2371  //==================================== Find map index
2372  mapIt = zIt + this->zDimIndices * ( yIt + this->yDimIndices * xIt );
2373 
2374  //==================================== Use only positive density
2375  if ( this->internalMap[mapIt] <= 0.0 ) { continue; }
2376 
2377  //==================================== Compute Index COM
2378  this->xCom += this->internalMap[mapIt] * static_cast<proshade_double> ( xIt + 1 );
2379  this->yCom += this->internalMap[mapIt] * static_cast<proshade_double> ( yIt + 1 );
2380  this->zCom += this->internalMap[mapIt] * static_cast<proshade_double> ( zIt + 1 );
2381  totNonZeroPoints += this->internalMap[mapIt];
2382  }
2383  }
2384  }
2385 
2386  this->xCom /= totNonZeroPoints;
2387  this->yCom /= totNonZeroPoints;
2388  this->zCom /= totNonZeroPoints;
2389 
2390  //================================================ Convert to real world
2391  this->xCom = ( (this->xCom-1) - this->xAxisOrigin ) * ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->xDimIndices - 1 ) / this->xDimSize );
2392  this->yCom = ( (this->yCom-1) - this->yAxisOrigin ) * ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->yDimIndices - 1 ) / this->yDimSize );
2393  this->zCom = ( (this->zCom-1) - this->zAxisOrigin ) * ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->zDimIndices - 1 ) / this->zDimSize );
2394 
2395  //================================================ Done
2396  return ;
2397 }

226  proshade_double trsX = 0.0, trsY = 0.0, trsZ = 0.0;
227  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::findHighestValueInMap ( this->getTranslationFnPointer(),
228  staticStructure->getXDim(),
229  staticStructure->getYDim(),
230  staticStructure->getZDim(),
231  &trsX,
232  &trsY,
233  &trsZ,
234  &mapPeak );
235 
236  //================================================ Dont translate over half
237  if ( trsX > ( staticStructure->getXDim() / 2 ) ) { trsX = trsX - this->getXDim(); }
238  if ( trsY > ( staticStructure->getYDim() / 2 ) ) { trsY = trsY - this->getYDim(); }
239  if ( trsZ > ( staticStructure->getZDim() / 2 ) ) { trsZ = trsZ - this->getZDim(); }
240 
241  //================================================ Move map
242  proshade_single xCor = ( staticStructure->xFrom - this->xFrom ) *
243  ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( staticStructure->getXDimSize() ) / staticStructure->getXDim() );
244  proshade_single yCor = ( staticStructure->yFrom - this->yFrom ) *
245  ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( staticStructure->getYDimSize() ) / staticStructure->getYDim() );
246  proshade_single zCor = ( staticStructure->zFrom - this->zFrom ) *
247  ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( staticStructure->getZDimSize() ) / staticStructure->getZDim() );
248  proshade_single xMov = staticStructure->comMovX - xCor -
249  ( trsX * static_cast<proshade_double> ( staticStructure->getXDimSize() ) / staticStructure->getXDim() );
250  proshade_single yMov = staticStructure->comMovY - yCor -
251  ( trsY * static_cast<proshade_double> ( staticStructure->getYDimSize() ) / staticStructure->getYDim() );
252  proshade_single zMov = staticStructure->comMovZ - zCor -
253  ( trsZ * static_cast<proshade_double> ( staticStructure->getZDimSize() ) / staticStructure->getZDim() );
254 
255  //================================================ Save results as vector
256  ProSHADE_internal_misc::addToDoubleVector ( &ret, static_cast<proshade_double> ( -xMov ) );
257  ProSHADE_internal_misc::addToDoubleVector ( &ret, static_cast<proshade_double> ( -yMov ) );
258  ProSHADE_internal_misc::addToDoubleVector ( &ret, static_cast<proshade_double> ( -zMov ) );
259 
260  //================================================ Done
261  return ( ret );
262 
263 }

◆ getCyclicSymmetriesList()

std::vector< proshade_double * > ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getCyclicSymmetriesList ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function obtains a list of all C symmetries from already computed self-rotation map.

This function starts by finding all peaks in the self-rotation map, which are outliers in terms of height. It then proceeds to group these by the height, searching for C symmetries in each peak height group (thus making sure symmetries with higher peak heights are found first). The symmetry detection proceeds by detecting possible C symmetry folds and searching whether the all peaks are present to support the prospective C symmetry. If only few are missing, it will even search for the missing peaks. Finally, the function returns all detected symmetries in the order of decreasing average peak height.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for symmetry detection.

Definition at line 69 of file ProSHADE_symmetry.cpp.

70 {
71  //================================================ Initialise variables
72  std::vector< proshade_double* > ret;
73 
74  //================================================ Report progress
75  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting C symmetry detection." );
76 
77  //================================================ Get list of peaks in the self-rotation map
78  std::vector< proshade_double* > allPeaks = ProSHADE_internal_peakSearch::getAllPeaksNaive ( this->getInvSO3Coeffs (), this->getMaxBand() * 2,
79  settings->peakNeighbours,
80  settings->noIQRsFromMedianNaivePeak );
81 
82  //================================================ Convert peaks to angle-axis
83  std::vector< proshade_double* > peaksAA = ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::getPeaksAngleAxisPositions ( allPeaks, settings->verbose );
84 
85  //================================================ Sort peaks by height groups
86  std::vector< proshade_double > peakGroupsBoundaries = ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findPeaksByHeightBoundaries ( peaksAA, settings->smoothingFactor );
87 
88  //================================================ Get symmetry per group
89  std::vector< std::vector< proshade_unsign > > detectedCSymmetries;
90  for ( proshade_signed iter = static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( peakGroupsBoundaries.size() - 1 ); iter >= 0; iter-- )
91  {
92  //============================================ Get peaks group peaks only
93  std::vector< proshade_double* > symPeaks;
94  for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( peaksAA.size() ); it++ )
95  {
96  if ( peaksAA.at(it)[4] > peakGroupsBoundaries.at(iter) ) { ProSHADE_internal_misc::addToDblPtrVector ( &symPeaks, peaksAA.at(it) ); }
97  }
98 
99  //============================================ Search for symmetry in these peaks
100  detectedCSymmetries = ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findPeaksCSymmetry ( &symPeaks, settings->verbose, this->getMaxBand(),
101  settings->symMissPeakThres,
102  settings->axisErrTolerance, this );
103 
104  //============================================ Print detected symmetries
105  for ( proshade_unsign detIt = 0; detIt < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( detectedCSymmetries.size() ); detIt++ ) { ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::printSymmetryGroup ( detectedCSymmetries.at(detIt), symPeaks, settings->verbose ); }
106 
107  //============================================ Save detected
108  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::saveAllCSymmetries ( detectedCSymmetries, symPeaks, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance );
109  }
110 
111  //================================================ Release memory
112  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( peaksAA.size() ); iter++ ) { delete[] allPeaks.at(iter); delete[] peaksAA.at(iter); }
113 
114  //================================================ Report completion
115  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::printSymmetryCompletion ( static_cast<proshade_unsign>( ret.size() ), settings->verbose );
116 
117  //================================================ Done
118  return ( ret );
119 
120 }

◆ getDihedralSymmetriesList()

std::vector< proshade_double * > ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getDihedralSymmetriesList ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSymList 
)

This function obtains a list of all D symmetries from already computed C symmetries list.

This function simply returns a vector of C symmetry pairs which are perpendicular to each other (and therefore form dihedral symmetry). The vector contains arrays of 12 double numbers with the following format: [0] = Fold of axis 1; [1] = X-axis of axis 1; [2] Y-axis of axis 1; [3] = Z-axis of axis 1; [4] = angle of axis 1; [5] = average peak height of axis 1; [6] = Fold of axis 2; [7] = X-axis of axis 2; [8] Y-axis of axis 2; [9] = Z-axis of axis 2; [10] = angle of axis 2; [11] = average peak height of axis 2. Note that the larger fold axis is listed first in this format.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for symmetry detection.
[in]CSymListA vector containing the already detected Cyclic symmetries.

Definition at line 1081 of file ProSHADE_symmetry.cpp.

1082 {
1083  //================================================ Initialise variables
1084  std::vector< proshade_double* > ret;
1085  proshade_double dotProduct;
1086 
1087  //================================================ Report progress
1088  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting D symmetry detection." );
1089 
1090  //================================================If not enough axes, just end here
1091  if ( CSymList->size() < 2 ) { return ( ret ); }
1092 
1093  //=============================================== For each unique pair of axes
1094  for ( proshade_unsign ax1 = 0; ax1 < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( CSymList->size() ); ax1++ )
1095  {
1096  for ( proshade_unsign ax2 = 0; ax2 < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( CSymList->size() ); ax2++ )
1097  {
1098  //======================================= Use unique pairs only
1099  if ( ax1 >= ax2 ) { continue; }
1100 
1101  //======================================= Compute the dot product
1102  dotProduct = ProSHADE_internal_maths::computeDotProduct ( &CSymList->at(ax1)[1], &CSymList->at(ax1)[2],
1103  &CSymList->at(ax1)[3], &CSymList->at(ax2)[1],
1104  &CSymList->at(ax2)[2], &CSymList->at(ax2)[3] );
1105 
1106  //======================================== If close to zero, these two axes are perpendicular
1107  if ( std::abs( dotProduct ) < settings->axisErrTolerance )
1108  {
1109  //==================================== Check for reasonable similarity in height
1110  if ( std::max ( CSymList->at(ax1)[5], CSymList->at(ax2)[5] ) > ( 3.0 * std::min ( CSymList->at(ax1)[5], CSymList->at(ax2)[5] ) ) ) { continue; }
1111 
1112  //==================================== Save
1113  if ( CSymList->at(ax1)[0] >= CSymList->at(ax2)[0] ) { ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::saveDSymmetry ( &ret, CSymList, ax1, ax2 ); }
1114  else { ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::saveDSymmetry ( &ret, CSymList, ax2, ax1 ); }
1115  }
1116  }
1117  }
1118 
1119  //================================================ Report progress
1120  std::stringstream hlpSS;
1121  hlpSS << "Detected " << ret.size() << " D symmetries.";
1122  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, hlpSS.str() );
1123 
1124  //================================================ Done
1125  return ( ret );
1126 
1127 }

◆ getIcosahedralSymmetriesList()

std::vector< proshade_double * > ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getIcosahedralSymmetriesList ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSymList 
)

This function obtains a list of all I symmetry axes from the already computed C symmetries list.

...

This function starts by checking if there is a pair of C3 and C4 symmetries with the octahedron dihedral angle ( acos ( 1/sqrt(3) ) ). If so, it will then assume existence of octahedral symmetry and it will search for three C4 axes, four C3 axes and six C2 axes with the correct angle to each other and within the group. If all required axes are detected, it will return a list of 13 axes, otherwise it will return empty or shorter list. Automated missing symmetry axis detection is also included.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for symmetry detection.
[in]CSymListA vector containing the already detected Cyclic symmetries.

Definition at line 2388 of file ProSHADE_symmetry.cpp.

2389 {
2390  //================================================ Initialise variables
2391  std::vector< proshade_double* > ret;
2392 
2393  //================================================ Report progress
2394  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting I symmetry detection." );
2395 
2396  //================================================ Are the basic requirements for tetrahedral symmetry met?
2397  if ( ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::detectIcosahedralSymmetry ( CSymList, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0 ) )
2398  {
2399  //============================================ Search for all the symmetry axes
2400  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findIcos6C5s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
2401  if ( ret.size() != 6 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
2402 
2403  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findIcos10C3s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
2404  if ( ret.size() != 16 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
2405 
2406  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findIcos15C2s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
2407  if ( ret.size() != 31 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
2408  }
2409 
2410  //================================================ Report progress
2411  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "I symmetry detection complete." );
2412 
2413  //================================================ Done
2414  return ( ret );
2415 
2416 }

◆ getOctahedralSymmetriesList()

std::vector< proshade_double * > ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getOctahedralSymmetriesList ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSymList 
)

This function obtains a list of all O symmetry axes from the already computed C symmetries list.

This function starts by checking if there is a pair of C3 and C4 symmetries with the octahedron dihedral angle ( acos ( 1/sqrt(3) ) ). If so, it will then assume existence of octahedral symmetry and it will search for three C4 axes, four C3 axes and six C2 axes with the correct angle to each other and within the group. If all required axes are detected, it will return a list of 13 axes, otherwise it will return empty or shorter list. Automated missing symmetry axis detection is also included.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for symmetry detection.
[in]CSymListA vector containing the already detected Cyclic symmetries.

Definition at line 1882 of file ProSHADE_symmetry.cpp.

1883 {
1884  //================================================ Initialise variables
1885  std::vector< proshade_double* > ret;
1886 
1887  //================================================ Report progress
1888  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting O symmetry detection." );
1889 
1890  //================================================ Are the basic requirements for tetrahedral symmetry met?
1891  if ( ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::detectOctahedralSymmetry ( CSymList, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0 ) )
1892  {
1893  //============================================ Search for all the symmetry axes
1894  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findOcta3C4s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
1895  if ( ret.size() != 3 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
1896 
1897  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findOcta4C3s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
1898  if ( ret.size() != 7 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
1899 
1900  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findOcta6C2s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
1901  if ( ret.size() != 13 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
1902  }
1903 
1904  //================================================ Report progress
1905  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "O symmetry detection complete." );
1906 
1907  //================================================ Done
1908  return ( ret );
1909 
1910 }

◆ getOverlayRotationFunction()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getOverlayRotationFunction ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data *  obj2 
)

This function computes the overlay rotation function (i.e. the correlation function in SO(3) space).

This function assumes it is called from the object to which the rotation function is to be assigned to (presumably the moving rather than static structure). It starts by computing the E matrices, normalising these using the Patterson-like normalisation, generating SO(3) coefficients from the E matrices and finally computing their inverse SOFT transform to get the rotation function.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map symmetry detection.
[in]obj2A pointer to the data class object of the other ( static ) structure.

Definition at line 35 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

36 {
37  //================================================ Report progress
38  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting rotation function computation." );
39 
40  //================================================ Compute un-weighted E matrices and their weights
41  ProSHADE_internal_distances::computeEMatrices ( obj2, this, settings );
42 
43  //================================================ Normalise E matrices by the magnitudes
44  ProSHADE_internal_distances::normaliseEMatrices ( obj2, this, settings );
45 
46  //================================================ Generate SO(3) coefficients
47  ProSHADE_internal_distances::generateSO3CoeffsFromEMatrices ( obj2, this, settings );
48 
49  //================================================ Compute the inverse SO(3) Fourier Transform (SOFT) on the newly computed coefficients
50  ProSHADE_internal_distances::computeInverseSOFTTransform ( obj2, this, settings );
51 
52  //================================================ Report completion
53  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Rotation function obtained." );
54 
55  //================================================ Done
56  return ;
57 
58 }
