◆ getReBoxBoundaries()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getReBoxBoundaries ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
proshade_signed *&  ret 
)

This function finds the boundaries enclosing positive map values and adds some extra space.

This function firstly finds the boundaries which enclose the positive map values and then it proceeds to add a given amount of space to all dimensions (positive and negative) to make sure the map does not end exactly at the bounds. It returns the new boundaries in the ret variable if they are smaller than the original bounds, or just the original bounds in case decrease was not achieved.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.
[in]retA pointer to proshade_signed array of 6 storing the results - (0 = minX; 1 = maxX; 2 = minY; 3 = maxY; 4 - minZ; 5 = maxZ).

Definition at line 1127 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1128 {
1129  //================================================ Report function start
1130  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Finding new boundaries." );
1131 
1132  //================================================ If same bounds as first one are required, test if possible and return these instead
1133  if ( settings->useSameBounds && ( this->inputOrder != 0 ) )
1134  {
1135  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < 6; iter++ ) { ret[iter] = settings->forceBounds[iter]; }
1136  }
1137  //================================================ In this case, bounds need to be found de novo
1138  else
1139  {
1140  //============================================ Find the non-zero bounds
1141  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::getNonZeroBounds ( this->internalMap, this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices,
1142  this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize, ret );
1143 
1144  //============================================ Add the extra space
1145  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::addExtraBoundSpace ( this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices,
1146  this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize, ret, settings->boundsExtraSpace );
1147 
1148  //============================================ Beautify boundaries
1149  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::beautifyBoundaries ( ret, this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices, settings->boundsSimilarityThreshold, settings->verbose );
1150 
1151  //============================================ Report function results
1152  std::stringstream ssHlp;
1153  ssHlp << "New boundaries are: " << ret[1] - ret[0] + 1 << " x " << ret[3] - ret[2] + 1 << " x " << ret[5] - ret[4] + 1;
1154  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 3, ssHlp.str() );
1155 
1156  //============================================ If need be, save boundaries to be used for all other structure
1157  if ( settings->useSameBounds && ( this->inputOrder == 0 ) )
1158  {
1159  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < 6; iter++ ) { settings->forceBounds[iter] = ret[iter]; }
1160  }
1161  }
1162 
1163  //================================================ Report function completion
1164  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "New boundaries determined." );
1165 
1166  //================================================ Done
1167  return ;
1168 
1169 }

◆ getReBoxBoundariesPy()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getReBoxBoundariesPy ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
int *  reBoxBounds,
int  len 
)

This function finds the boundaries enclosing positive map values and adds some extra space, returning values in Python friendly format.

This function firstly finds the boundaries which enclose the positive map values and then it proceeds to add a given amount of space to all dimensions (positive and negative) to make sure the map does not end exactly at the bounds. It returns the new boundaries in the ret variable if they are smaller than the original bounds, or just the original bounds in case decrease was not achieved. The return format is Python friendly, otherwise it is the same function as the getReBoxBoundaries() function.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.
[in]retA pointer to proshade_signed array of 6 storing the results - (0 = minX; 1 = maxX; 2 = minY; 3 = maxY; 4 - minZ; 5 = maxZ).
[in]lenThe length of the ret array - must always be 6, but Swig/Numpy requires this number to be passed.

◆ getRotationFunction()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getRotationFunction ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function computes the self-rotation function for this structure.

This function assumes that the spherical harmonics have been computed for a data object. It can be then called on this object and it will proceed to compute the E matrices for this object against itself. From these "self E matrices", the function will generate the SO(3) transform coefficients and finally it will invert transform these coefficients back, thus getting the self-rotation function.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map self-rotation function computation.

Definition at line 34 of file ProSHADE_symmetry.cpp.

35 {
36  //================================================ Report progress
37  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting self-rotation function computation." );
38 
39  //================================================ Compute un-weighted E matrices and their weights
40  ProSHADE_internal_distances::computeEMatrices ( this, this, settings );
41 
42  //================================================ Normalise E matrices by the magnitudes
43  ProSHADE_internal_distances::normaliseEMatrices ( this, this, settings );
44 
45  //================================================ Generate SO(3) coefficients
46  ProSHADE_internal_distances::generateSO3CoeffsFromEMatrices ( this, this, settings );
47 
48  //================================================ Compute the inverse SO(3) Fourier Transform (SOFT) on the newly computed coefficients
49  ProSHADE_internal_distances::computeInverseSOFTTransform ( this, this, settings );
50 
51  //================================================ Report completion
52  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Self-rotation function obtained." );
53 
54  //================================================ Done
55  return ;
56 
57 }

◆ getSpherePositions()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getSpherePositions ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function determines the sphere positions (radii) for sphere mapping.

This function determines the radii of the concentric spheres (as measured from the centre of the map). This is done by checking if these values have already been as and if not, then the radii are placed between points of the map starting between the centre point and its neighbours and then adding spheres until the most outlying diagonal point is covered.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

Definition at line 1661 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1662 {
1663  //================================================ Check the current settings value is set to auto
1664  if ( this->spherePos.size() != 0 )
1665  {
1666  std::stringstream hlpSS;
1667  hlpSS << "The sphere distances were determined as " << this->spherePos.at(0);
1668  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 1; iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( this->spherePos.size() ); iter++ ) { hlpSS << "; " << this->spherePos.at(iter); }
1669  hlpSS << " Angstroms.";
1670  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 3, hlpSS.str() );
1671  return ;
1672  }
1673 
1674  //================================================ Find maximum diagonal
1675  proshade_unsign maxDim = std::max ( this->xDimSize, std::max ( this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize ) );
1676  proshade_unsign minDim = std::min ( this->xDimSize, std::min ( this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize ) );
1677  proshade_unsign midDim = 0;
1678  if ( ( this->xDimSize < maxDim ) && ( this->xDimSize > minDim ) ) { midDim = this->xDimSize; }
1679  else if ( ( this->yDimSize < maxDim ) && ( this->yDimSize > minDim ) ) { midDim = this->yDimSize; }
1680  else { midDim = this->zDimSize; }
1681 
1682  proshade_single maxDiag = std::sqrt ( std::pow ( static_cast<proshade_single> ( maxDim ), 2.0 ) +
1683  std::pow ( static_cast<proshade_single> ( midDim ), 2.0 ) );
1684 
1685  //================================================ Set between the points
1686  for ( proshade_single iter = 0.5; ( iter * settings->maxSphereDists ) < ( maxDiag / 2.0 ); iter += 1.0 )
1687  {
1688  ProSHADE_internal_misc::addToSingleVector ( &this->spherePos, ( iter * settings->maxSphereDists ) );
1689  }
1690 
1691  //================================================ Save the number of spheres
1692  this->noSpheres = static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( this->spherePos.size() );
1693 
1694  //================================================ Report progress
1695  std::stringstream hlpSS;
1696  hlpSS << "The sphere distances were determined as " << this->spherePos.at(0);
1697  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 1; iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( this->spherePos.size() ); iter++ ) { hlpSS << "; " << this->spherePos.at(iter); }
1698  hlpSS << " Angstroms.";
1699  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 3, hlpSS.str() );
1700 
1701  //================================================ Done
1702  return ;
1703 
1704 }

3108 
3109  //================================================ Return the value
3110  return ( static_cast<int> ( (this->spheres[shellNo]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2) * (this->spheres[shellNo]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2) ) );
3111 }

◆ getTetrahedralSymmetriesList()

std::vector< proshade_double * > ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::getTetrahedralSymmetriesList ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSymList 
)

This function obtains a list of all T symmetry axes from the already computed C symmetries list.

This function starts by checking if there are two C3 symmetries with the tetrahedral dihedral angle. If so, it proceeds to search for all seven symmetry axes expected to form a full tetrahedral symmetry. It then returns the list of found symmetries; if full tetrahedral symmetry was found, seven axes (four C3s and three C2s) are returned. If less than seven symmetries are returned, the procedure has failed and no tetrahedral symmetry was found.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for symmetry detection.
[in]CSymListA vector containing the already detected Cyclic symmetries.

Definition at line 1179 of file ProSHADE_symmetry.cpp.

1180 {
1181  //================================================ Initialise variables
1182  std::vector< proshade_double* > ret;
1183 
1184  //================================================ Report progress
1185  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting T symmetry detection." );
1186 
1187  //================================================ Are the basic requirements for tetrahedral symmetry met?
1188  if ( ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::detectTetrahedralSymmetry ( CSymList, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0 ) )
1189  {
1190  //============================================ Search for all the symmetry axes
1191  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findTetra4C3s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
1192  if ( ret.size() != 4 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
1193 
1194  ProSHADE_internal_symmetry::findTetra3C2s ( CSymList, &ret, settings->axisErrTolerance * 2.0, this, settings->verbose );
1195  if ( ret.size() != 7 ) { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printWarningMessage ( settings->verbose, "!!! ProSHADE WARNING !!! Failed to detect some of the polyhedral symmetries, while detecting the correct dihedral angles.", "WS00030" ); return ( ret ); }
1196  }
1197 
1198  //================================================ Report progress
1199  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "T symmetry detection complete." );
1200 
1201  //================================================ Done
1202  return ( ret );
1203 
1204 }

◆ interpolateMapFromSpheres()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::interpolateMapFromSpheres ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
proshade_double *&  densityMapRotated 
)

This function interpolates the density map from the sphere mapped data.

Parameters
[in]settingsThe settings object specifying how exactly the rotation is to be done.
[in]densityMapRotatedThe pointer to allocated memory where the new map values will be held.

Definition at line 931 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

932 {
933  //================================================ Initialise variables
934  proshade_double rad = 0.0, lon = 0.0, lat = 0.0, newU = 0.0, newV = 0.0, newW = 0.0;
935  proshade_unsign lowerLonL = 0, upperLonL = 0, lowerLonU = 0, upperLonU = 0, lowerLatL = 0, upperLatL = 0, lowerLatU = 0, upperLatU = 0, lowerShell = 0, upperShell = 0;
936  proshade_double x00 = 0.0, x01 = 0.0, x10 = 0.0, x11 = 0.0, distLLon = 0.0, distLLat = 0.0, distLRad = 0.0, valLLon = 0.0, valULon = 0.0;
937  proshade_double lowerShellValue = 0.0, upperShellValue = 0.0;
938  proshade_double xSamplingRate = static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->xDimSize ) / this->xDimIndices;
939  proshade_double ySamplingRate = static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->yDimSize ) / this->yDimIndices;
940  proshade_double zSamplingRate = static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->zDimSize ) / this->zDimIndices;
941  proshade_signed arrPos;
942  std::vector<proshade_double> lonCOU, latCOU, lonCOL, latCOL;
943 
944  for ( proshade_signed uIt = 0; uIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> (this->xDimIndices); uIt++ )
945  {
946  for ( proshade_signed vIt = 0; vIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> (this->yDimIndices); vIt++ )
947  {
948  for ( proshade_signed wIt = 0; wIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> (this->zDimIndices); wIt++ )
949  {
950  //==================================== Convert to centered coords
951  newU = static_cast<proshade_double> ( uIt - ( static_cast<proshade_signed> (this->xDimIndices) / 2 ) );
952  newV = static_cast<proshade_double> ( vIt - ( static_cast<proshade_signed> (this->yDimIndices) / 2 ) );
953  newW = static_cast<proshade_double> ( wIt - ( static_cast<proshade_signed> (this->zDimIndices) / 2 ) );
954 
955  //==================================== Deal with 0 ; 0 ; 0
956  if ( ( newU == 0.0 ) && ( newV == 0.0 ) && ( newW == 0.0 ) )
957  {
958  arrPos = wIt + this->zDimIndices * ( vIt + this->yDimIndices * uIt );
959  densityMapRotated[arrPos] = this->internalMap[arrPos];
960  continue;
961  }
962 
963  //==================================== Convert to spherical coords
964  rad = sqrt ( pow( ( newU * xSamplingRate ), 2.0 ) +
965  pow( ( newV * ySamplingRate ), 2.0 ) +
966  pow( ( newW * zSamplingRate ), 2.0 ) );
967  lon = atan2 ( ( newV * ySamplingRate ), ( newU * xSamplingRate ) );
968  lat = asin ( ( newW * zSamplingRate ) / rad );
969 
970  //==================================== Deal with nan's
971  if ( rad != rad ) { rad = 0.0; }
972  if ( lon != lon ) { lon = 0.0; }
973  if ( lat != lat ) { lat = 0.0; }
974 
975  //==================================== Find shells above and below
976  lowerShell = 0;
977  upperShell = 0;
978  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < (this->noSpheres-1); iter++ )
979  {
980  if ( ( this->spherePos.at(iter) <= rad ) && ( this->spherePos.at(iter+1) > rad ) )
981  {
982  lowerShell = iter;
983  upperShell = iter+1;
984  break;
985  }
986  }
987 
988  if ( upperShell == 0 )
989  {
990  arrPos = wIt + this->zDimIndices * ( vIt + this->yDimIndices * uIt );
991  densityMapRotated[arrPos] = 0.0;
992  continue;
993  }
994 
995  //==================================== Get the longitude and lattitude cut-offs for this shell ()
996  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::computeAngularThreshold ( &lonCOL, &latCOL, this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() );
997  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::computeAngularThreshold ( &lonCOU, &latCOU, this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() );
998 
999  //==================================== Find the angle cutoffs around the point
1000  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes(); iter++ )
1001  {
1002  if ( ( std::floor(10000. * lonCOL.at(iter)) <= std::floor(10000. * lon) ) && ( std::floor(10000. * lonCOL.at(iter+1)) > std::floor(10000. * lon) ) )
1003  {
1004  lowerLonL = iter;
1005  upperLonL = iter+1;
1006  break;
1007  }
1008  }
1009  if ( upperLonL == this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() ) { upperLonL = 0; }
1010 
1011  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes(); iter++ )
1012  {
1013  if ( ( std::floor(10000. * lonCOU.at(iter)) <= std::floor(10000. * lon) ) && ( std::floor(10000. * lonCOU.at(iter+1)) > std::floor(10000. * lon) ) )
1014  {
1015  lowerLonU = iter;
1016  upperLonU = iter+1;
1017  break;
1018  }
1019  }
1020  if ( upperLonU == this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() ) { upperLonU = 0; }
1021 
1022  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes(); iter++ )
1023  {
1024  if ( ( std::floor(10000. * latCOL.at(iter)) <= std::floor(10000. * lat) ) && ( std::floor(10000. * latCOL.at(iter+1)) > std::floor(10000. * lat) ) )
1025  {
1026  lowerLatL = iter;
1027  upperLatL = iter+1;
1028  break;
1029  }
1030  }
1031  if ( upperLatL == this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() ) { upperLatL = 0; }
1032 
1033  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes(); iter++ )
1034  {
1035  if ( ( std::floor(10000. * latCOU.at(iter)) <= std::floor(10000. * lat) ) && ( std::floor(10000. * latCOU.at(iter+1)) > std::floor(10000. * lat) ) )
1036  {
1037  lowerLatU = iter;
1038  upperLatU = iter+1;
1039  break;
1040  }
1041  }
1042  if ( upperLatU == this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() ) { upperLatU = 0; }
1043 
1044  //==================================== Interpolate lower shell
1045  x00 = this->spheres[lowerShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( lowerLatL * this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() + lowerLonL );
1046  x01 = this->spheres[lowerShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( lowerLatL * this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() + upperLonL );
1047  x10 = this->spheres[lowerShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( upperLatL * this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() + lowerLonL );
1048  x11 = this->spheres[lowerShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( upperLatL * this->spheres[lowerShell]->getLocalAngRes() + upperLonL );
1049 
1050  distLLon = std::abs ( lon - lonCOL.at(lowerLonL) ) / ( std::abs( lon - lonCOL.at(lowerLonL) ) + std::abs( lon - lonCOL.at(upperLonL) ) );
1051  valLLon = ( ( 1.0 - distLLon ) * x00 ) + ( distLLon * x01 );
1052  valULon = ( ( 1.0 - distLLon ) * x10 ) + ( distLLon * x11 );
1053 
1054  distLLat = std::abs ( lat - latCOL.at(lowerLatL) ) / ( std::abs( lat - latCOL.at(lowerLatL) ) + std::abs( lat - latCOL.at(upperLatL) ) );
1055  lowerShellValue = ( ( 1.0 - distLLat ) * valLLon ) + ( distLLat * valULon );
1056 
1057  //==================================== Interpolate upper shell
1058  x00 = this->spheres[upperShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( lowerLatU * this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() + lowerLonU );
1059  x01 = this->spheres[upperShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( lowerLatU * this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() + upperLonU );
1060  x10 = this->spheres[upperShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( upperLatU * this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() + lowerLonU );
1061  x11 = this->spheres[upperShell]->getRotatedMappedData ( upperLatU * this->spheres[upperShell]->getLocalAngRes() + upperLonU );
1062 
1063  distLLon = std::abs ( lon - lonCOU.at(lowerLonU) ) / ( std::abs( lon - lonCOU.at(lowerLonU) ) + std::abs( lon - lonCOU.at(upperLonU) ) );
1064  valLLon = ( ( 1.0 - distLLon ) * x00 ) + ( distLLon * x01 );
1065  valULon = ( ( 1.0 - distLLon ) * x10 ) + ( distLLon * x11 );
1066 
1067  distLLat = std::abs ( lat - latCOU.at(lowerLatU) ) / ( std::abs( lat - latCOU.at(lowerLatU) ) + std::abs( lat - latCOU.at(upperLatU) ) );
1068  upperShellValue = ( ( 1.0 - distLLat ) * valLLon ) + ( distLLat * valULon );
1069 
1070  //==================================== Interpolate between shells
1071  distLRad = std::abs ( rad - this->spherePos.at(lowerShell) ) / ( std::abs( rad - this->spherePos.at(lowerShell) ) +
1072  std::abs( rad - this->spherePos.at(upperShell) ) );
1073 
1074  arrPos = wIt + this->zDimIndices * ( vIt + this->yDimIndices * uIt );
1075  densityMapRotated[arrPos] = ( ( 1.0 - distLRad ) * lowerShellValue ) + ( distLRad * upperShellValue );
1076  }
1077 
1078  }
1079 
1080  }
1081 
1082  //================================================ Done
1083  return ;
1084 
1085 }

◆ inverseSHCoefficients()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::inverseSHCoefficients ( void  )

This function computes the shell mapped data from inverting the Spherical Harmonics coefficients.

Definition at line 835 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

836 {
837  //================================================ Initialise local variables
838  double *sigR = NULL, *sigI = NULL, *rcoeffs = NULL, *icoeffs = NULL, *weights = NULL, *workspace = NULL;
839  fftw_plan idctPlan, ifftPlan;
840 
841  //================================================ For each shell
842  for ( int shell = 0; shell < static_cast<int> ( this->noSpheres ); shell++ )
843  {
844  //=========================================== Initialise internal variables
845  proshade_unsign oneDim = this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth() * 2;
846 
847  //=========================================== Allocate memory
848  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::initialiseInverseSHComputation ( this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth(), sigR, sigI, rcoeffs, icoeffs, weights, workspace, idctPlan, ifftPlan );
849 
850  //=========================================== Compute weights for the transform using the appropriate shell related band
851  makeweights ( this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth(), weights );
852 
853  //============================================ Allocate rotated shell mapped data memory
854  this->spheres[shell]->allocateRotatedMap ( );
855 
856  //============================================ Load SH coeffs to arrays
857  for ( unsigned int iter = 0; iter < static_cast<unsigned int> ( oneDim * oneDim ); iter++ )
858  {
859  rcoeffs[iter] = this->rotSphericalHarmonics[shell][iter][0];
860  icoeffs[iter] = this->rotSphericalHarmonics[shell][iter][1];
861  sigR[iter] = 0.0;
862  sigI[iter] = 0.0;
863  }
864 
865  //============================================ Get inverse spherical harmonics transform for the shell
866  InvFST_semi_fly ( rcoeffs,
867  icoeffs,
868  sigR,
869  sigI,
870  this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth(),
871  workspace,
872  0,
873  this->spheres[shell]->getLocalBandwidth(),
874  &idctPlan,
875  &ifftPlan );
876 
877  //=========================================== Copy the results to the rotated shells array
878  for ( unsigned int iter = 0; iter < static_cast<unsigned int> ( oneDim * oneDim ); iter++ )
879  {
880  this->spheres[shell]->setRotatedMappedData ( iter, sigR[iter] );
881  }
882 
883  //=========================================== Release the plans
884  fftw_destroy_plan ( idctPlan );
885  fftw_destroy_plan ( ifftPlan );
886 
887  //=========================================== Release the memory
888  delete[] sigR;
889  delete[] sigI;
890  delete[] rcoeffs;
891  delete[] icoeffs;
892  delete[] weights;
893  delete[] workspace;
894  }
895 
896  //================================================ Done
897  return ;
898 
899 }

◆ invertMirrorMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::invertMirrorMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

Function for inverting the map to its mirror image.

This function switches all index values along the three axes from 0 ... max to max ... 0. This should not normally be done, but in the case where the wrong hand has been used in the map re-construction process, this may be helpful.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.

Definition at line 986 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

987 {
988  //================================================ Report function start
989  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Map inversion." );
990 
991  //================================================ Initialise variables
992  proshade_signed arrayPos, invPos;
993 
994  //================================================ Create helper map
995  proshade_double* hlpMap = new proshade_double [this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
996  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( hlpMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
997 
998  //================================================ Save map values to the helper map
999  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
1000  {
1001  hlpMap[iter] = this->internalMap[iter];
1002  }
1003 
1004  //================================================ Invert the values
1005  for ( proshade_signed xIt = 0; xIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->xDimIndices ); xIt++ )
1006  {
1007  for ( proshade_signed yIt = 0; yIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->yDimIndices ); yIt++ )
1008  {
1009  for ( proshade_signed zIt = 0; zIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->zDimIndices ); zIt++ )
1010  {
1011  //==================================== Var init
1012  arrayPos = zIt + this->zDimIndices * ( yIt + this->yDimIndices * xIt );
1013  invPos = ( (this->zDimIndices-1) - zIt ) + this->zDimIndices * ( ( (this->yDimIndices-1) - yIt ) + this->yDimIndices * ( (this->xDimIndices-1) - xIt ) );
1014 
1015  //==================================== And save
1016  this->internalMap[invPos] = hlpMap[arrayPos];
1017  }
1018  }
1019  }
1020 
1021  //================================================ Release memory
1022  delete[] hlpMap;
1023 
1024  //================================================ Report function completion
1025  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Map inversion completed." );
1026 
1027  //================================================ Done
1028  return ;
1029 
1030 }

◆ mapToSpheres()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::mapToSpheres ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function simply clusters several other functions which should be called together.

This function serves to cluster the map normalisation, map masking, map centering and map extra space addition into a single function. This allows for simpler code and does not take any control away, as all the decisions are ultimately driven by the settings.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

1738  &this->spherePos, settings->progressiveSphereMapping, settings->maxBandwidth,
1739  settings->maxAngRes, this->internalMap, &this->maxShellBand );

◆ maskMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::maskMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

Function for computing the map mask using blurring and X IQRs from median.

This function takes all the internal map representation information from the calling object and the internal map itself and proceeds to write all this information in MRC MAP format for visualisation and further processing by other software. It is dependent on the internal information being correct.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.

◆ normaliseMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::normaliseMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

Function for normalising the map to mean 0 and sd 1..

This function takes the map and changes its value to have mean 0 and standard deviation of 1. This should make two maps with very different density levels more comparable, but it remains to be seen if this causes any trouble. Can be turned off using the settings options.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.

Definition at line 1040 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

1041 {
1042  //================================================ Report function start
1043  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Map normalisation." );
1044 
1045  //================================================ Initialise vector of map values
1046  std::vector<proshade_double> mapVals ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices, 0.0 );
1047 
1048  //================================================ Get all map values
1049  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
1050  {
1051  mapVals.at(iter) = this->internalMap[iter];
1052  }
1053 
1054  //================================================ Get mean and sd
1055  proshade_double* meanSD = new proshade_double[2];
1056  ProSHADE_internal_maths::vectorMeanAndSD ( &mapVals, meanSD );
1057 
1058  //================================================ Normalise the values
1059  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
1060  {
1061  this->internalMap[iter] = ( this->internalMap[iter] - meanSD[0] ) / meanSD[1];
1062  }
1063 
1064  //================================================ Clear the vector
1065  mapVals.clear ( );
1066 
1067  //================================================ Release memory
1068  delete[] meanSD;
1069 
1070  //================================================ Report function completion
1071  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Map normalisation completed." );
1072 
1073  //================================================ Done
1074  return ;
1075 
1076 }

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::processInternalMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function simply clusters several other functions which should be called together.

This function serves to cluster the map normalisation, map masking, map centering and map extra space addition into a single function. This allows for simpler code and does not take any control away, as all the decisions are ultimately driven by the settings.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

1619  //================================================ Invert map
1620  if ( settings->invertMap ) { this->invertMirrorMap ( settings ); }
1621  else { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Map inversion (mirror image) not requested." ); }
1622 
1623  //================================================ Normalise map
1624  if ( settings->normaliseMap ) { this->normaliseMap ( settings ); }
1625  else { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Map normalisation not requested." ); }
1626 
1627  //================================================ Compute mask
1628  //if ( settings->maskMap ) { if ( settings->useCorrelationMasking ) { this->maskMapCorrelation ( settings ); } else { this->maskMap ( settings ); } }

1630  else { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Masking not requested." ); }
1631 
1632  //================================================ Centre map
1633  if ( settings->moveToCOM ) { this->centreMapOnCOM ( settings ); }
1634  else { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Map centering not requested." ); }
1635

1637  if ( settings->addExtraSpace != 0.0 ) { this->addExtraSpace ( settings ); }
1638  else { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Extra space not requested." ); }
1639

1642  else { ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Phase information retained in the data." ); }
1643 
1644  //================================================ Compute and save the original map values
1645  this->setOriginalMapValues ( );
1646 
1647  //================================================ Done
1648  return ;

503  }
504

506  this->figureIndexStartStop ( );
507

509  if ( settings->changeMapResolution )
510  {
511  this->reSampleMap ( settings );
512  }
513 
514  //================================================ Done
515 
516 }

◆ readInPDB()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::readInPDB ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)
protected

Function for reading pdb data.

This function reads in the pdb data using the information from the settings object, converts the co-ordinates onto a theoretical map and and saves all the results into the structure calling it.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.

Definition at line 525 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

526 {
527  //================================================ Set resolution if need be
528  if ( settings->requestedResolution < 0.0 )
529  {
530  settings->setResolution ( 8.0 );
531  }
532 
533  //================================================ Open PDB file for reading
534  clipper::mmdb::CMMDBManager *pdbFile = new clipper::mmdb::CMMDBManager ( );
535  if ( pdbFile->ReadCoorFile ( this->fileName.c_str() ) )
536  {
537  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "MMDB Failed to open PDB file.", "EP00010", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "While attempting to open file\n : " + this->fileName + "\n : for reading, MMDB library failed to open the file. This\n : could be caused by not being formatted properly or by\n : memory not being sufficient." );
538  }
539 
540  //================================================ Find the ranges
541  proshade_single xF, xT, yF, yT, zF, zT;
542  int noAtoms;
543  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::determinePDBRanges ( pdbFile, &xF, &xT, &yF, &yT, &zF, &zT, &noAtoms );
544 
545  //================================================ Change B-factors if need be
546  if ( settings->pdbBFactorNewVal >= 0.0 )
547  {
548  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::changePDBBFactors ( pdbFile, settings->pdbBFactorNewVal );
549  }
550 
551  //================================================ Move ranges to have all FROM values 20
552  proshade_single xMov = 20.0 - xF;
553  proshade_single yMov = 20.0 - yF;
554  proshade_single zMov = 20.0 - zF;
555  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::movePDBForClipper ( pdbFile, xMov, yMov, zMov );
556 
557  //================================================ Set the angstrom sizes
558  this->xDimSize = xT - xF + 40.0;
559  this->yDimSize = yT - yF + 40.0;
560  this->zDimSize = zT - zF + 40.0;
561 
562  //================================================ Generate map from nicely placed atoms (cell size will be range + 40)
563  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::generateMapFromPDB ( pdbFile, this->internalMap, settings->requestedResolution, this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize, noAtoms, &this->xTo, &this->yTo, &this->zTo );
564 
565  //================================================ Set the internal variables to correct values
566  this->setPDBMapValues ( );
567 
568  //================================================ Move map back to the original PDB location
569  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::moveMapByIndices ( &xMov, &yMov, &zMov, this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize,
570  &this->xFrom, &this->xTo, &this->yFrom, &this->yTo, &this->zFrom, &this->zTo,
571  &this->xAxisOrigin, &this->yAxisOrigin, &this->zAxisOrigin );
572  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::moveMapByFourier ( this->internalMap, xMov, yMov, zMov, this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize,
573  this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices );
574 
575  //================================================ Release the PDB file
576  delete pdbFile;
577 
578  //================================================ If specific resolution is requested, make sure the map has it
579  if ( settings->changeMapResolution )
580  {
581  this->reSampleMap ( settings );
582  }
583 
584  //================================================ Done
585 
586 }

◆ readInStructure()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::readInStructure ( std::string  fName,
proshade_unsign  inputO,
ProSHADE_settings *  settings 
)

This function initialises the basic ProSHADE_data variables and reads in a single structure.

This function is basically the constructor for the ProSHADE_data class. It reads in a structure (independent of the structure type) and fills in all the appropriate variables of the class.

Parameters
[in]fNameThe file name of the file which should be loaded.
[in]inputOThe order of this structure in this run's input.
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.

Definition at line 415 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

416 {
417  //================================================ Report function start
418  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Starting to read the structure: " + fName );
419 
420  //================================================ Check if instance is empty
421  if ( !this->isEmpty )
422  {
423  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Structure data class not empty.", "E000005", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "Attempted to read in structure into a ProSHADE_data\n : object which already does have structure read in\n : i.e. " + this->fileName );
424  }
425 
426  //================================================ Save the filename
427  this->fileName = fName;
428 
429  //================================================ Check what is the input format
430  this->fileType = ProSHADE_internal_io::figureDataType ( this->fileName );
431 
432  //================================================ Save input order
433  this->inputOrder = inputO;
434 
435  //================================================ Decide how to proceed
436  switch ( this->fileType )
437  {
438  case ProSHADE_internal_io::UNKNOWN:
439  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Unknown file type.", "E000006", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "When attempting to read the file\n : " + this->fileName + "\n : the file extension was determined as unknown. This could\n : mean either that the file does not exist, or that it is\n : not one of the supported extensions." );
440  break;
441 
442  case ProSHADE_internal_io::PDB:
443  this->readInPDB ( settings );
444  break;
445 
446  case ProSHADE_internal_io::MAP:
447  this->readInMAP ( settings );
448  break;
449  }
450 
451  //================================================ This structure is now full
452  this->isEmpty = false;
453 
454  //================================================ Report function completion
455  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Structure read in successfully." );
456 
457  //================================================ Done
458  return ;
459 
460 }

◆ removePhaseInormation()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::removePhaseInormation ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function removes phase from the map.

This function is called when the phase information needs to be removed from the internal map representation. It does the forward Fourier transform, removes the phase from the Fourier coefficients and then the inverse Fourier transform, thus resulting with the Patterson map. It does write over the original map.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map manipulation.

Definition at line 2470 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2471 {
2472  //================================================ Report function start
2473  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 1, "Centering map onto its COM." );
2474 
2475  //================================================ Copy map for processing
2476  fftw_complex* mapCoeffs = new fftw_complex[this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
2477  fftw_complex* pattersonMap = new fftw_complex[this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
2478 
2479  //================================================ Check memory allocation
2480  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( mapCoeffs, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
2481  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( pattersonMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
2482 
2483  //================================================ Copy data to mask
2484  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < (this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices); iter++ )
2485  {
2486  pattersonMap[iter][0] = this->internalMap[iter];
2487  pattersonMap[iter][1] = 0.0;
2488  }
2489 
2490  //================================================ Prepare FFTW plans
2491  fftw_plan forward = fftw_plan_dft_3d ( this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices,
2492  pattersonMap, mapCoeffs, FFTW_FORWARD, FFTW_ESTIMATE );
2493  fftw_plan inverse = fftw_plan_dft_3d ( this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices,
2494  mapCoeffs, pattersonMap, FFTW_BACKWARD, FFTW_ESTIMATE );
2495 
2496  //================================================ Run forward Fourier
2497  fftw_execute ( forward );
2498 
2499  //================================================ Remove the phase
2500  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::removeMapPhase ( mapCoeffs, this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices );
2501 
2502  //================================================ Run inverse Fourier
2503  fftw_execute ( inverse );
2504 
2505  //================================================ Save the results
2506  proshade_signed mapIt, patIt, patX, patY, patZ;
2507  for ( proshade_signed xIt = 0; xIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->xDimIndices ); xIt++ )
2508  {
2509  for ( proshade_signed yIt = 0; yIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->yDimIndices ); yIt++ )
2510  {
2511  for ( proshade_signed zIt = 0; zIt < static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->zDimIndices ); zIt++ )
2512  {
2513  //==================================== Centre patterson map
2514  patX = xIt - ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->xDimIndices ) / 2 ); if ( patX < 0 ) { patX += this->xDimIndices; }
2515  patY = yIt - ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->yDimIndices ) / 2 ); if ( patY < 0 ) { patY += this->yDimIndices; }
2516  patZ = zIt - ( static_cast<proshade_signed> ( this->zDimIndices ) / 2 ); if ( patZ < 0 ) { patZ += this->zDimIndices; }
2517 
2518  //==================================== Find indices
2519  mapIt = zIt + this->zDimIndices * ( yIt + this->yDimIndices * xIt );
2520  patIt = patZ + this->zDimIndices * ( patY + this->yDimIndices * patX );
2521 
2522  //==================================== Copy
2523  this->internalMap[mapIt] = pattersonMap[patIt][0];
2524  }
2525  }
2526  }
2527 
2528  //================================================ Release memory
2529  delete[] pattersonMap;
2530  delete[] mapCoeffs;
2531 
2532  //================================================ Delete FFTW plans
2533  fftw_destroy_plan ( forward );
2534  fftw_destroy_plan ( inverse );
2535 
2536  //================================================ Report function completion
2537  ProSHADE_internal_messages::printProgressMessage ( settings->verbose, 2, "Phase information removed." );
2538 
2539  //================================================ Done
2540  return ;
2541 
2542 }

◆ reportSymmetryResults()

◆ reSampleMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::reSampleMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings)

This function changes the internal map sampling to conform to particular resolution value.

This function will take the requested resolution value from the settings object and will proceed to change the internal map sampling to conform to requested resolution / 2 and therefore to the requested resolution map.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for reading in the map.

1418  ( this->xFrom * ( this->xDimSize / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->xDimIndices ) ) ) );
1419  proshade_single yMov = -( ( this->yFrom * ( this->yDimSize / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->yDimIndices - changeVals[1] ) ) ) -

1422  ( this->zFrom * ( this->zDimSize / static_cast<proshade_single> ( this->zDimIndices ) ) ) );
1423 
1424  //================================================ Move by indices (this should be sufficient)

1429  this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices );

1433 
1434  //================================================ Done
1435  return ;

◆ rotateMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::rotateMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
proshade_double  eulerAlpha,
proshade_double  eulerBeta,
proshade_double  eulerGamma 
)

This function rotates a map based on the given Euler angles.

This function starts by computing the Wigner D matrices for the given Euler angles and then it proceeds to multiply the spherical harmonics coefficients with these, thus producing spherical harmonics coefficients of a rotated structure. Then, it computes the inverse spherical harmonics decomposition, thus obtaining the sphere mapped values for the rotated structure. Finally, it interpolates these sphere mapped values back to Cartesian grid, thus obtaining a map rotated by the given Euler angles.

Parameters
[in]settingsThe settings object specifying how exactly the rotation is to be done.
[in]eulerAlphaThe rotation expressed as a pointer to Euler alpha angle.
[in]eulerBetaThe rotation expressed as a pointer to Euler beta angle.
[in]eulerGammaThe rotation expressed as a pointer to Euler gamma angle.

Definition at line 621 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

622 {
623  //================================================ Set maximum comparison bandwidth to maximum object bandwidth
624  this->maxCompBand = this->spheres[this->noSpheres-1]->getLocalBandwidth();
625 
626  //================================================ Compute the Wigner D matrices for the Euler angles
627  ProSHADE_internal_wigner::computeWignerMatricesForRotation ( settings, this, -eulerAlpha, eulerBeta, -eulerGamma );
628 
629  //================================================ Initialise rotated Spherical Harmonics memory
630  this->allocateRotatedSHMemory ( settings );
631 
632  //================================================ Multiply SH coeffs by Wigner
633  this->computeRotatedSH ( settings );
634 
635  //================================================ Inverse the SH coeffs to shells
636  this->inverseSHCoefficients ( );
637 
638  //================================================ Find spherical cut-offs
639  std::vector<proshade_double> lonCO, latCO;
640  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::computeAngularThreshold ( &lonCO, &latCO, settings->maxAngRes );
641 
642  //================================================ Allocate memory for the rotated map
643  proshade_double *densityMapRotated = new proshade_double [this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
644  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( densityMapRotated, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
645  for ( unsigned int iter = 0; iter < static_cast<unsigned int> ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ ) { densityMapRotated[iter] = 0.0; }
646 
647  //================================================ Interpolate onto cartesian grid
648  this->interpolateMapFromSpheres ( settings, densityMapRotated);
649 
650  //================================================ Copy map
651  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
652  {
653  this->internalMap[iter] = densityMapRotated[iter];
654  }
655 
656  //================================================ Re-calculate the map COM
657  this->findMapCOM ( );
658  this->mapPostRotXCom = this->xCom;
659  this->mapPostRotYCom = this->yCom;
660  this->mapPostRotZCom = this->zCom;
661 
662  //================================================ Release rotated map (original is now rotated)
663  delete[] densityMapRotated;
664 
665  //================================================ Done
666  return ;
667 
668 }

◆ saveRecommendedSymmetry()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::saveRecommendedSymmetry ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  DSym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  TSym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  OSym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  ISym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  axes 
)

This function takes all the detected symmetry results and decides on which are to be recommended for this structure.

This function starts by obtaining the scores (fold weighted height averages) for each of the detectable symmetry types. Then, it proceeds to compute which of these should be recommended by ProSHADE based on a little shaky combination of axes number and score. This part needs to be improved by using ML estimation, when I get the time.

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map symmetry detection.
[in]CSymA vector of pointers to double arrays, each array being a single Cyclic symmetry entry.
[in]DSymA vector of pointers to double arrays, each array being a single Dihedral symmetry entry.
[in]TSymA vector of pointers to double arrays, all of which together form the axes of tetrahedral symmetry.
[in]OSymA vector of pointers to double arrays, all of which together form the axes of octahedral symmetry.
[in]ISymA vector of pointers to double arrays, all of which together form the axes of icosahedral symmetry.
[in]axesA vector to which all the axes of the recommended symmetry (if any) will be saved.

Definition at line 2105 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2106 {
2107  //================================================ Initialise variables
2108  proshade_double cScore = 0.0, dScore = 0.0, tScore = 0.0, oScore = 0.0, iScore = 0.0;
2109  proshade_unsign bestCIndex, bestDIndex;
2110 
2111  //================================================ Find a score for each input symmetry type.
2112  cScore = this->findBestCScore ( CSym, &bestCIndex );
2113  dScore = this->findBestDScore ( DSym, &bestDIndex );
2114  tScore = this->findTScore ( TSym );
2115  oScore = this->findOScore ( OSym );
2116  iScore = this->findIScore ( ISym );
2117 
2118  //================================================ Find the best available score
2119  proshade_double bestWeightedScore = std::max ( cScore, std::max ( dScore * 2.0, std::max ( tScore * 3.0, std::max ( oScore * 4.0, iScore * 5.0 ) ) ) );
2120 
2121 
2122  //================================================ No score? Well, no symmetry.
2123  if ( bestWeightedScore < 0.05 ) { settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "" ); return; }
2124 
2125  if ( bestWeightedScore == cScore )
2126  {
2127  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "C" );
2128  settings->setRecommendedFold ( CSym->at(bestCIndex)[0] );
2129  settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( CSym->at(bestCIndex) );
2130  ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, CSym->at(bestCIndex) );
2131  }
2132  if ( bestWeightedScore == dScore * 2.0 )
2133  {
2134  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "D" );
2135  settings->setRecommendedFold ( std::max ( DSym->at(bestDIndex)[0], DSym->at(bestDIndex)[6] ) );
2136  settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( DSym->at(bestDIndex) );
2137  settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( &DSym->at(bestDIndex)[6] );
2138  ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, DSym->at(bestDIndex) );
2139  ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, &DSym->at(bestDIndex)[6] );
2140  }
2141  if ( bestWeightedScore == tScore * 3.0 )
2142  {
2143  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "T" );
2144  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
2145  for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( TSym->size() ); it++ ) { settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( TSym->at(it) ); ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, TSym->at(it) ); }
2146  }
2147  if ( bestWeightedScore == oScore * 4.0 )
2148  {
2149  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "O" );
2150  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
2151  for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( OSym->size() ); it++ ) { settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( OSym->at(it) ); ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, OSym->at(it) ); }
2152  }
2153  if ( bestWeightedScore == iScore * 5.0 )
2154  {
2155  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "I" );
2156  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
2157  for ( proshade_unsign it = 0; it < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( ISym->size() ); it++ ) { settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( ISym->at(it) ); ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, ISym->at(it) ); }
2158  }
2159 
2160  //======================================== Done
2161  return ;
2162 
2163 }

◆ saveRequestedSymmetryC()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::saveRequestedSymmetryC ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  CSym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  axes 
)

This function takes the C symmetries and searched for the requested symmetry.

This is a simple search function, which searches the symmetry results for the requested symmetry fold, and if more such symmetries are found, takes the one with the highest average peak height. If the requested fold was found, it will save it to the settings object, while it will set the object to fold 0 if the requested symmetry was not found (albeit there may be other symmetries present).

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map symmetry detection.
[in]CSymA vector of pointers to double arrays, each array being a single Cyclic symmetry entry.
[in]axesA vector to which all the axes of the requested symmetry (if any) will be saved.

Definition at line 2176 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2177 {
2178  //================================================ Initialise variables
2179  proshade_unsign bestIndex = 0;
2180  proshade_double highestSym = 0.0;
2181 
2182  //================================================ Search for best fold
2183  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( CSym->size() ); iter++ )
2184  {
2185  //============================================ Check if it is tbe correct fold
2186  if ( CSym->at(iter)[0] != settings->requestedSymmetryFold ) { continue; }
2187 
2188  //============================================ If correct, is it the highest found?
2189  if ( CSym->at(iter)[5] > highestSym )
2190  {
2191  highestSym = CSym->at(iter)[5];
2192  bestIndex = iter;
2193  }
2194  }
2195 
2196  //================================================ Found?
2197  if ( highestSym > 0.0 )
2198  {
2199  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "C" );
2200  settings->setRecommendedFold ( CSym->at(bestIndex)[0] );
2201  settings->setDetectedSymmetry ( CSym->at(bestIndex) );
2202  ProSHADE_internal_misc::deepCopyAxisToDblPtrVector ( axes, CSym->at(bestIndex) );
2203  }
2204  else
2205  {
2206  settings->setRecommendedSymmetry ( "" );
2207  settings->setRecommendedFold ( 0 );
2208  }
2209 
2210  //================================================ Done
2211  return ;
2212 
2213 }

◆ saveRequestedSymmetryD()

std::vector< proshade_double * > *  DSym,
std::vector< proshade_double * > *  axes 
)

This function takes the D symmetries and searched for the requested symmetry.

This is a simple search function, which searches the symmetry results for the requested symmetry fold, and if more such symmetries are found, takes the one with the highest average peak height sum. If the requested fold was found, it will save it to the settings object, while it will set the object to fold 0 if the requested symmetry was not found (albeit there may be other symmetries present).

Parameters
[in]settingsA pointer to settings class containing all the information required for map symmetry detection.
[in]DSymA vector of pointers to double arrays, each array being a single Dihedral symmetry entry.
[in]axesA vector to which all the axes of the requested symmetry (if any) will be saved.

◆ setOriginalMapValues()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::setOriginalMapValues ( void  )
protected

This function sets the original structure representation value to a set of dedicated variables.

This function is called once a structure hes been read in and initially processed by ProSHADE. Therefore, the values it saves are already after axis inversion, COM centering, etc., but before any map rotation or map padding. The reason why these values need to be saved is because in some circumstances (such as PDB file wiritng) these are required and the normal variables holding these may be over-written by the map manipulation process.

Definition at line 2323 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

2324 {
2325  //================================================ Compute and save the COM
2326  this->findMapCOM ( );
2327  this->originalMapXCom = this->xCom;
2328  this->originalMapYCom = this->yCom;
2329  this->originalMapZCom = this->zCom;
2330 
2331  //================================================ Save the original sizes
2332  this->xDimSizeOriginal = this->xDimSize;
2333  this->yDimSizeOriginal = this->yDimSize;
2334  this->zDimSizeOriginal = this->zDimSize;
2335 
2336  //================================================ Save the original index counts
2337  this->xDimIndicesOriginal = this->xDimIndices;
2338  this->yDimIndicesOriginal = this->yDimIndices;
2339  this->zDimIndicesOriginal = this->zDimIndices;
2340 
2341  //================================================ Save the original axis origins
2342  this->xAxisOriginOriginal = this->xAxisOrigin;
2343  this->yAxisOriginOriginal = this->yAxisOrigin;
2344  this->zAxisOriginOriginal = this->zAxisOrigin;
2345 
2346  //================================================ Done
2347  return ;
2348 
2349 }

◆ setWignerMatrixValue()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::setWignerMatrixValue ( proshade_complex  val,
proshade_unsign  band,
proshade_unsign  order1,
proshade_unsign  order2 
)

This function allows setting the Wigner D matrix value by its band, order1 and order2 co-ordinate.

Parameters
[in]valproshade_complex value of the Wigner D matrix at position band, order1, order2.
[in]bandThe band of the Wigner D matrix value.
[in]order1The first order of the Wigner D matrix value.

◆ shellBandExists()

proshade_unsign  bandVal 
)

This function checks if particular shell has a particular band.

This function is useful for the progressive shell mapping, where it may not be clear in one part of the code whether a particular shell does or does not have a particular band value. Therefore, this function allows simple check.

Parameters
[in]shellThe index (number) of the shell for which the check should be done.
[in]bandValThe band value which should be sought for the shell.
[out]XTrue if the shell has the band, false otherwise.

This function is called to change the axes order for map data read in non-XYZ order.

655 {
656  //================================================ Establish the axes order
657  if ( ( this->xAxisOrder == 1 ) && ( this->yAxisOrder == 2 ) )
658  {
659  //============================================ Order is XYZ - Nothing to be done
660  return ;
661  }
662

664  {
665  //============================================ Order is XZY
666  proshade_single tmp = this->yDimSize;
667  this->yDimSize = this->zDimSize;

◆ translateMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::translateMap ( ProSHADE_settings *  settings,
proshade_double  trsX,
proshade_double  trsY,
proshade_double  trsZ 
)

This function simply translates the map by a given number of Angstroms along the three axes.

This function calls the internal functions to first provide the maximum possible movement by changing the frame of the map and secondly, it make the precise movement within this new frame using the Fourier translation approach.

Parameters
[in]settingsThe settings object specifying how exactly the rotation is to be done.
[in]trsXThe translation expressed as a number of angstroms to move by along the x-axis.
[in]trsYThe translation expressed as a number of angstroms to move by along the y-axis.
[in]trsZThe translation expressed as a number of angstroms to move by along the z-axis.

Definition at line 680 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

681 {
682  //================================================ Initialise local variables
683  proshade_single xMov = -trsX, yMov = -trsY, zMov = -trsZ;
684 
685  //================================================ Move the whole map frame to minimise the Fourier movement
686  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::moveMapByIndices ( &xMov, &yMov, &zMov, this->getXDimSize(), this->getYDimSize(), this->getZDimSize(),
687  this->getXFromPtr(), this->getXToPtr(), this->getYFromPtr(), this->getYToPtr(),
688  this->getZFromPtr(), this->getZToPtr(), this->getXAxisOrigin(), this->getYAxisOrigin(), this->getZAxisOrigin() );
689 
690  //================================================ Finalise the movement by in-frame Fourier movement
691  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::moveMapByFourier ( this->getInternalMap(), xMov, yMov, zMov, this->getXDimSize(), this->getYDimSize(), this->getZDimSize(),
692  this->getXDim(), this->getYDim(), this->getZDim() );
693 
694  //================================================ Done
695  return ;
696 
697 }

◆ writeMap()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::writeMap ( std::string  fName,
std::string  title = "" 
)

Function for writing out the internal structure representation in MRC MAP format.

This function takes all the internal map representation information from the calling object and the internal map itself and proceeds to write all this information in MRC MAP format for visualisation and further processing by other software. It is dependent on the internal information being correct.

Parameters
[in]fNameThe filename (including path) to where the output MAP file should be saved.
[in]titleString with the map title to be written into the header - default value is "ProSHADE generated map"

839  mapFile = reinterpret_cast<CMap_io::CMMFile*> ( CMap_io::ccp4_cmap_open ( fName.c_str() , myMapMode ) );
840  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( mapFile, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
841 
842  //================================================ Write map header
843  ProSHADE_internal_io::writeMapCell ( mapFile, this->xDimSize, this->yDimSize, this->zDimSize, this->aAngle, this->bAngle, this->cAngle );
844  ProSHADE_internal_io::writeMapGrid ( mapFile, this->xGridIndices, this->yGridIndices, this->zGridIndices );

847  ProSHADE_internal_io::writeMapOrigin ( mapFile, this->xAxisOrigin, this->yAxisOrigin, this->zAxisOrigin );

854  CMap_io::ccp4_cmap_close ( mapFile );
855 
856  //================================================ Done
857  return ;

◆ writeMask()

)

Function for writing out a mask in MRC MAP format.

This function takes a mask map and the filename and proceeds to write out the mask into the requested file name in th MRC MAP format. It assumes that the mask has the same dimmensions as the map.

[in]fileNameThe filename (including path) to where the output should be saved.
[in]maskPointer to the mask map array.

950 {
951  //================================================ Allocate the memory
952  proshade_double* hlpMap = new proshade_double[this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices];
953  ProSHADE_internal_misc::checkMemoryAllocation ( hlpMap, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__ );
954 
955  //================================================ Copy original map and over-write with the mask
956  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
957  {
958  hlpMap[iter] = this->internalMap[iter];
959  this->internalMap[iter] = mask[iter];
960  }
961 
962  //================================================ Write out the mask
963  this->writeMap ( fName );
964 
965  //================================================ Copy the original map values back
966  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < ( this->xDimIndices * this->yDimIndices * this->zDimIndices ); iter++ )
967  {
968  this->internalMap[iter] = hlpMap[iter];
969  }

◆ writePdb()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::writePdb ( std::string  fName,
proshade_double  euA = 0.0,
proshade_double  euB = 0.0,
proshade_double  euG = 0.0,
proshade_double  transX = 0.0,
proshade_double  transY = 0.0,
proshade_double  transZ = 0.0 
)

This function writes out the PDB formatted file coresponding to the structure.

This function first checks if this internal structure originated from co-ordinate file (only if co-ordinates are provided can they be written out). If so, it will proceed to

Parameters
[in]fNameThe filename (including path) to where the output PDB file should be saved.
[in]euAThe Euler angle alpha by which the co-ordinates should be rotated (leave empty if no rotation is required).
[in]euBThe Euler angle beta by which the co-ordinates should be rotated (leave empty if no rotation is required).
[in]euGThe Euler angle gamma by which the co-ordinates should be rotated (leave empty if no rotation is required).
[in]transXThe translation to be done along the X-axis in Angstroms.
[in]transYThe translation to be done along the Y-axis in Angstroms.
[in]transZThe translation to be done along the Z-axis in Angstroms.

Definition at line 874 of file ProSHADE_data.cpp.

875 {
876  //================================================ Check for co-ordinate origin
877  if ( !ProSHADE_internal_io::isFilePDB ( this->fileName ) )
878  {
879  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Cannot write co-ordinate file if the input file did not contain co-ordinates.", "EP00045", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "You have called the WritePDB function on structure which\n : was created by reading in a map. This is not allowed as\n : ProSHADE cannot create co-ordinates from map file." );
880  }
881 
882  //================================================ Open the original PDB file
883  clipper::mmdb::CMMDBManager *pdbFile = new clipper::mmdb::CMMDBManager ( );
884  if ( pdbFile->ReadCoorFile ( this->fileName.c_str() ) )
885  {
886  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "MMDB Failed to open PDB file.", "EP00010", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "While attempting to open file\n : " + this->fileName + "\n : for reading, MMDB library failed to open the file. This\n : could be caused by not being formatted properly or by\n : memory not being sufficient." );
887  }
888 
889  //================================================ If the map was rotated, do the same for the co-ordinates, making sure we take into account the rotation centre of the map
890  if ( ( euA != 0.0 ) || ( euB != 0.0 ) || ( euG != 0.0 ) )
891  {
892  //============================================ Save original PDB COM position
893  proshade_double xCOMOriginal = 0.0, yCOMOriginal = 0.0, zCOMOriginal = 0.0;
894  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::findPDBCOMValues ( pdbFile, &xCOMOriginal, &yCOMOriginal, &zCOMOriginal );
895 
896  //============================================ Compute the rotation centre for the co-ordinates
897  proshade_double xRotPos = ( ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->xDimIndicesOriginal / 2 ) - this->xAxisOriginOriginal ) *
898  ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->xDimIndicesOriginal - 1 ) / this->xDimSizeOriginal ) ) -
899  (this->originalMapXCom - xCOMOriginal);
900  proshade_double yRotPos = ( ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->yDimIndicesOriginal / 2 ) - this->yAxisOriginOriginal ) *
901  ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->yDimIndicesOriginal - 1 ) / this->yDimSizeOriginal ) ) -
902  (this->originalMapYCom - yCOMOriginal);
903  proshade_double zRotPos = ( ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->zDimIndicesOriginal / 2 ) - this->zAxisOriginOriginal ) *
904  ( static_cast<proshade_double> ( this->zDimIndicesOriginal - 1 ) / this->zDimSizeOriginal ) ) -
905  (this->originalMapZCom - zCOMOriginal);
906 
907  //============================================ Rotate the co-ordinates
908  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::rotatePDBCoordinates ( pdbFile, euA, euB, euG, xRotPos, yRotPos, zRotPos );
909 
910  //============================================ Compute the after rotation PDB COM position
911  proshade_double xCOMRotated = 0.0, yCOMRotated = 0.0, zCOMRotated = 0.0;
912  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::findPDBCOMValues ( pdbFile, &xCOMRotated, &yCOMRotated, &zCOMRotated );
913 
914  //============================================ Compute the after rotation position correction
915  proshade_double xPDBTrans = ( xCOMRotated - xCOMOriginal ) + ( this->mapPostRotXCom - this->originalMapXCom );
916  proshade_double yPDBTrans = ( yCOMRotated - yCOMOriginal ) + ( this->mapPostRotYCom - this->originalMapYCom );
917  proshade_double zPDBTrans = ( zCOMRotated - zCOMOriginal ) + ( this->mapPostRotZCom - this->originalMapZCom );
918 
919  //============================================ Correct the co-ordinate position after rotation
920  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::translatePDBCoordinates ( pdbFile, xPDBTrans, yPDBTrans, zPDBTrans );
921  }
922 
923  //================================================ Translate by required translation and the map centering (if applied)
924  ProSHADE_internal_mapManip::translatePDBCoordinates ( pdbFile, this->comMovX + transX, this->comMovY + transY, this->comMovZ + transZ );
925 
926  //================================================ Write the PDB file
927  if ( pdbFile->WritePDBASCII ( fName.c_str() ) )
928  {
929  std::stringstream hlpMessage;
930  hlpMessage << "Failed to open the PDB file " << fName << " for output.";
931  throw ProSHADE_exception ( hlpMessage.str().c_str(), "EP00046", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "ProSHADE has failed to open the PDB output file. This is\n : likely caused by either not having the write privileges\n : to the required output path, or by making a mistake in\n : the path." );
932  }
933 
934  //================================================ Release memory
935  delete pdbFile;
936 
937  //================================================ Done
938  return ;
939 }

◆ zeroPaddToDims()

void ProSHADE_internal_data::ProSHADE_data::zeroPaddToDims ( proshade_unsign  xDim,
proshade_unsign  yDim,
proshade_unsign  zDim 
)

This function increases the size of a structure to fit the supplied new limits.

This function increases the map size by symetrically adding zeroes in each required dimension. The first zero is always added AFTER the structure, so for even size increases, there will be misplacement of centre of mass. The map position in the "real" world should not change.

Parameters
[in]xDimThe X dimension size to which this structure should be padded into.
[in]yDimThe Y dimension size to which this structure should be padded into.
[in]zDimThe Z dimension size to which this structure should be padded into.

Definition at line 483 of file ProSHADE_overlay.cpp.

484 {
485  //================================================ Sanity check
486  if ( ( this->xDimIndices > xDim ) || ( this->yDimIndices > yDim ) || ( this->zDimIndices > zDim ) )
487  {
488  throw ProSHADE_exception ( "Cannot zero-pad in negative direction.", "EO00033", __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "The requested padded size of a structure is smaller than\n : the current size. If the user sees this error, there is\n : likely a considerable bug. Please report this error." );
489  }
490 
491  //================================================ If done, do nothing
492  if ( ( this->xDimIndices == xDim ) && ( this->yDimIndices == yDim ) && ( this->zDimIndices == zDim ) ) { return ; }
493 
494  //================================================ Find out how many zeroes need to be added before and after
495  proshade_unsign addXPre, addYPre, addZPre, addXPost, addYPost, addZPost;
496  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::computeBeforeAfterZeroCounts ( &addXPre, &addYPre, &addZPre, &addXPost, &addYPost, &addZPost, xDim, yDim, zDim, this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices );
497 
498  //================================================ Create a new map
499  proshade_double* newMap = new proshade_double [xDim * yDim * zDim];
500 
501  //================================================ Do the hard work
502  ProSHADE_internal_overlay::paddMapWithZeroes ( this->internalMap, newMap, xDim, yDim, zDim, this->xDimIndices, this->yDimIndices, this->zDimIndices, addXPre, addYPre, addZPre );
503 
504  //================================================ Create a new internal map and copy
505  delete[] this->internalMap;
506  this->internalMap = new proshade_double [xDim * yDim * zDim];
507  for ( proshade_unsign iter = 0; iter < static_cast<proshade_unsign> ( xDim * yDim * zDim ); iter++ ) { this->internalMap[iter] = newMap[iter]; }
508 
509  //================================================ Release memory
510  delete[] newMap;
511 
512  //================================================ Update map related variables
513  this->xDimSize = xDim * ( this->xDimSize / this->xDimIndices );
514  this->yDimSize = yDim * ( this->yDimSize / this->yDimIndices );
515  this->zDimSize = zDim * ( this->zDimSize / this->zDimIndices );
516  this->xDimIndices = xDim ; this->yDimIndices = yDim ; this->zDimIndices = zDim;
517  this->xGridIndices = xDim ; this->yGridIndices = yDim ; this->zGridIndices = zDim;
518  this->xFrom -= addXPre ; this->yFrom -= addYPre ; this->zFrom -= addZPre;
519  this->xTo += addXPost; this->yTo += addYPost; this->zTo += addZPost;
520  this->xAxisOrigin -= addXPre ; this->yAxisOrigin -= addYPre ; this->zAxisOrigin -= addZPre ;
521 
522  //================================================ Done
523  return ;
524 
525 }
